◆ AllocateRenderCommand()

SDL_RenderCommand * AllocateRenderCommand ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
404{
405 SDL_RenderCommand *result = NULL;
406
407 result = renderer->render_commands_pool;
408 if (result) {
409 renderer->render_commands_pool = result->next;
410 result->next = NULL;
411 } else {
412 result = (SDL_RenderCommand *)SDL_calloc(1, sizeof(*result));
413 if (!result) {
414 return NULL;
415 }
416 }
417
418 SDL_assert((renderer->render_commands == NULL) == (renderer->render_commands_tail == NULL));
419 if (renderer->render_commands_tail) {
420 renderer->render_commands_tail->next = result;
421 } else {
422 renderer->render_commands = result;
423 }
424 renderer->render_commands_tail = result;
425
426 return result;
427}

◆ CreateDebugTextAtlas()

bool CreateDebugTextAtlas ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
5790{
5791 SDL_assert(renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas == NULL); // don't double-create it!
5792
5793 const int charWidth = SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE;
5794 const int charHeight = SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE;
5795
5796 // actually make each glyph two pixels taller/wider, to prevent scaling artifacts.
5797 const int rows = (SDL_DEBUG_FONT_NUM_GLYPHS / SDL_DEBUG_FONT_GLYPHS_PER_ROW) + 1;
5798 SDL_Surface *atlas = SDL_CreateSurface((charWidth + 2) * SDL_DEBUG_FONT_GLYPHS_PER_ROW, rows * (charHeight + 2), SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA8888);
5799 if (!atlas) {
5800 return false;
5801 }
5802
5803 const int pitch = atlas->pitch;
5804 SDL_memset(atlas->pixels, '\0', atlas->h * atlas->pitch);
5805
5806 int column = 0;
5807 int row = 0;
5808 for (int glyph = 0; glyph < SDL_DEBUG_FONT_NUM_GLYPHS; glyph++) {
5809 // find top-left of this glyph in destination surface. The +2's account for glyph padding.
5810 Uint8 *linepos = (((Uint8 *)atlas->pixels) + ((row * (charHeight + 2) + 1) * pitch)) + ((column * (charWidth + 2) + 1) * sizeof (Uint32));
5811 const Uint8 *charpos = SDL_RenderDebugTextFontData + (glyph * 8);
5812
5813 // Draw the glyph to the surface...
5814 for (int iy = 0; iy < charHeight; iy++) {
5815 Uint32 *curpos = (Uint32 *)linepos;
5816 for (int ix = 0; ix < charWidth; ix++) {
5817 if ((*charpos) & (1 << ix)) {
5818 *curpos = 0xffffffff;
5819 } else {
5820 *curpos = 0;
5821 }
5822 ++curpos;
5823 }
5824 linepos += pitch;
5825 ++charpos;
5826 }
5827
5828 // move to next position (and if too far, start the next row).
5829 column++;
5830 if (column >= SDL_DEBUG_FONT_GLYPHS_PER_ROW) {
5831 row++;
5832 column = 0;
5833 }
5834 }
5835
5836 SDL_assert((row < rows) || ((row == rows) && (column == 0))); // make sure we didn't overflow the surface.
5837
5838 // Convert temp surface into texture
5839 SDL_Texture *texture = SDL_CreateTextureFromSurface(renderer, atlas);
5840 if (texture) {
5841 SDL_SetTextureScaleMode(texture, SDL_SCALEMODE_PIXELART);
5842 renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas = texture;
5843 }
5844 SDL_DestroySurface(atlas);
5845
5846 return texture != NULL;
5847}
SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA8888
@ SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA8888

214#if 0

◆ DrawDebugCharacter()

bool DrawDebugCharacter ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float x,
float y,
Uint32 c )
static
5850{
5851 SDL_assert(renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas != NULL); // should have been created by now!
5852
5853 const int charWidth = SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE;
5854 const int charHeight = SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE;
5855
5856 // Character index in cache
5857 Uint32 ci = c;
5858 if ((ci <= 32) || ((ci >= 127) && (ci <= 160))) {
5859 return true; // these are just completely blank chars, don't bother doing anything.
5860 } else if (ci >= SDL_DEBUG_FONT_NUM_GLYPHS) {
5861 ci = SDL_DEBUG_FONT_NUM_GLYPHS - 1; // use our "not a valid/supported character" glyph.
5862 } else if (ci < 127) {
5863 ci -= 33; // adjust for the 33 blank glyphs at the start
5864 } else {
5865 ci -= 67; // adjust for the 33 blank glyphs at the start AND the 34 gap in the middle.
5866 }
5867
5868 const float src_x = (float) (((ci % SDL_DEBUG_FONT_GLYPHS_PER_ROW) * (charWidth + 2)) + 1);
5869 const float src_y = (float) (((ci / SDL_DEBUG_FONT_GLYPHS_PER_ROW) * (charHeight + 2)) + 1);
5870
5871 // Draw texture onto destination
5872 const SDL_FRect srect = { src_x, src_y, (float) charWidth, (float) charHeight };
5873 const SDL_FRect drect = { x, y, (float) charWidth, (float) charHeight };
5874 return SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas, &srect, &drect);
5875}

◆ FlushRenderCommands()

bool FlushRenderCommands ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
311{
312 bool result;
313
314 SDL_assert((renderer->render_commands == NULL) == (renderer->render_commands_tail == NULL));
315
316 if (!renderer->render_commands) { // nothing to do!
317 SDL_assert(renderer->vertex_data_used == 0);
318 return true;
319 }
320
321 DebugLogRenderCommands(renderer->render_commands);
322
323 result = renderer->RunCommandQueue(renderer, renderer->render_commands, renderer->vertex_data, renderer->vertex_data_used);
324
325 // Move the whole render command queue to the unused pool so we can reuse them next time.
326 if (renderer->render_commands_tail) {
327 renderer->render_commands_tail->next = renderer->render_commands_pool;
328 renderer->render_commands_pool = renderer->render_commands;
329 renderer->render_commands_tail = NULL;
330 renderer->render_commands = NULL;
331 }
332 renderer->vertex_data_used = 0;
333 renderer->render_command_generation++;
334 renderer->color_queued = false;
335 renderer->viewport_queued = false;
336 renderer->cliprect_queued = false;
337 return result;
338}
DebugLogRenderCommands
static SDL_INLINE void DebugLogRenderCommands(const SDL_RenderCommand *cmd)
Definition SDL_render.c:212

bool cliprect_queued
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:323

bool viewport_queued
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:322

bool(* RunCommandQueue)(SDL_Renderer *renderer, SDL_RenderCommand *cmd, void *vertices, size_t vertsize)
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:235
SDL_Renderer::vertex_data
void * vertex_data
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:325

bool color_queued
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:321
SDL_Renderer::render_command_generation

Definition SDL_sysrender.h:315

Definition SDL_sysrender.h:326

Referenced by FlushRenderCommandsIfGPURenderStateNeeded(), FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(), SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing(), SDL_FlushRenderer(), SDL_GetRenderMetalCommandEncoder(), SDL_GetRenderMetalLayer(), SDL_RenderPresent(), SDL_RenderReadPixels(), and SDL_SetRenderTarget().

◆ FlushRenderCommandsIfGPURenderStateNeeded()

bool FlushRenderCommandsIfGPURenderStateNeeded ( SDL_GPURenderState * state)
static
351{
352 SDL_Renderer *renderer = state->renderer;
353 if (state->last_command_generation == renderer->render_command_generation) {
354 // the current command queue depends on this state, flush the queue now before it changes
355 return FlushRenderCommands(renderer);
356 }
357 return true;
358}

◆ GetClosestSupportedFormat()

SDL_PixelFormat GetClosestSupportedFormat ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_PixelFormat format )
static
1348{
1349 int i;
1350
1351 if (format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_MJPG) {
1352 // We'll decode to SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV12 or SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA32
1353 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1354 if (renderer->texture_formats[i] == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV12) {
1355 return renderer->texture_formats[i];
1356 }
1357 }
1358 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1359 if (renderer->texture_formats[i] == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA32) {
1360 return renderer->texture_formats[i];
1361 }
1362 }
1363 } else if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC(format)) {
1364 // Look for an exact match
1365 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1366 if (renderer->texture_formats[i] == format) {
1367 return renderer->texture_formats[i];
1368 }
1369 }
1370 } else if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(format) || SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(format)) {
1371 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(format)) {
1372 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1373 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(renderer->texture_formats[i])) {
1374 return renderer->texture_formats[i];
1375 }
1376 }
1377 }
1378 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1379 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(renderer->texture_formats[i])) {
1380 return renderer->texture_formats[i];
1381 }
1382 }
1383 } else {
1384 bool hasAlpha = SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(format);
1385
1386 // We just want to match the first format that has the same channels
1387 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1388 if (!SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC(renderer->texture_formats[i]) &&
1389 SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(renderer->texture_formats[i]) == hasAlpha) {
1390 return renderer->texture_formats[i];
1391 }
1392 }
1393 }
1394 return renderer->texture_formats[0];
1395}
SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA
#define SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(format)
Definition SDL_pixels.h:478
SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT
#define SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(format)

◆ GetRenderViewportSize()

void GetRenderViewportSize ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_FRect * rect )
static
3094{
3095 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3096 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
3097 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
3098
3099 rect->x = 0.0f;
3100 rect->y = 0.0f;
3101
3102 if (view->viewport.w >= 0) {
3103 rect->w = (float)view->viewport.w;
3104 } else {
3105 rect->w = view->pixel_w / scale_x;
3106 }
3107
3108 if (view->viewport.h >= 0) {
3109 rect->h = (float)view->viewport.h;
3110 } else {
3111 rect->h = view->pixel_h / scale_y;
3112 }
3113}

◆ IsSupportedBlendMode()

bool IsSupportedBlendMode ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_BlendMode blendMode )
static
1318{
1319 switch (blendMode) {
1320 // These are required to be supported by all renderers
1321 case SDL_BLENDMODE_NONE:
1322 case SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND:
1323 case SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND_PREMULTIPLIED:
1324 case SDL_BLENDMODE_ADD:
1325 case SDL_BLENDMODE_ADD_PREMULTIPLIED:
1326 case SDL_BLENDMODE_MOD:
1327 case SDL_BLENDMODE_MUL:
1328 return true;
1329
1330 default:
1331 return renderer->SupportsBlendMode && renderer->SupportsBlendMode(renderer, blendMode);
1332 }
1333}

◆ PrepQueueCmdDraw()

SDL_RenderCommand * PrepQueueCmdDraw ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_RenderCommandType cmdtype,
SDL_Texture * texture )
static
550{
551 SDL_RenderCommand *cmd = NULL;
552 bool result = true;
553 SDL_FColor *color;
554 SDL_BlendMode blendMode;
555
556 if (texture) {
557 color = &texture->color;
558 blendMode = texture->blendMode;
559 } else {
560 color = &renderer->color;
561 blendMode = renderer->blendMode;
562 }
563
564 if (cmdtype != SDL_RENDERCMD_GEOMETRY) {
565 result = QueueCmdSetDrawColor(renderer, color);
566 }
567
568 /* Set the viewport and clip rect directly before draws, so the backends
569 * don't have to worry about that state not being valid at draw time. */
570 if (result && !renderer->viewport_queued) {
571 result = QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer);
572 }
573 if (result && !renderer->cliprect_queued) {
574 result = QueueCmdSetClipRect(renderer);
575 }
576
577 if (result) {
578 cmd = AllocateRenderCommand(renderer);
579 if (cmd) {
580 cmd->command = cmdtype;
581 cmd->data.draw.first = 0; // render backend will fill this in.
582 cmd->data.draw.count = 0; // render backend will fill this in.
583 cmd->data.draw.color_scale = renderer->color_scale;
584 cmd->data.draw.color = *color;
585 cmd->data.draw.blend = blendMode;
586 cmd->data.draw.texture = texture;
587 if (texture) {
588 cmd->data.draw.texture_scale_mode = texture->scaleMode;
589 }
590 cmd->data.draw.texture_address_mode_u = SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP;
591 cmd->data.draw.texture_address_mode_v = SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP;
592 cmd->data.draw.gpu_render_state = renderer->gpu_render_state;
593 if (renderer->gpu_render_state) {
594 renderer->gpu_render_state->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
595 }
596 }
597 }
598 return cmd;
599}

◆ QueueCmdClear()

bool QueueCmdClear ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
536{
537 SDL_RenderCommand *cmd = AllocateRenderCommand(renderer);
538 if (!cmd) {
539 return false;
540 }
541
542 cmd->command = SDL_RENDERCMD_CLEAR;
543 cmd->data.color.first = 0;
544 cmd->data.color.color_scale = renderer->color_scale;
545 cmd->data.color.color = renderer->color;
546 return true;
547}

◆ QueueCmdFillRects()

bool QueueCmdFillRects ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_FRect * rects,
const int count )
static
628{
629 SDL_RenderCommand *cmd;
630 bool result = false;
631 const int use_rendergeometry = (!renderer->QueueFillRects);
632
633 cmd = PrepQueueCmdDraw(renderer, (use_rendergeometry ? SDL_RENDERCMD_GEOMETRY : SDL_RENDERCMD_FILL_RECTS), NULL);
634
635 if (cmd) {
636 if (use_rendergeometry) {
637 bool isstack1;
638 bool isstack2;
639 float *xy = SDL_small_alloc(float, 4 * 2 * count, &isstack1);
640 int *indices = SDL_small_alloc(int, 6 * count, &isstack2);
641
642 if (xy && indices) {
643 int i;
644 float *ptr_xy = xy;
645 int *ptr_indices = indices;
646 const int xy_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
647 const int num_vertices = 4 * count;
648 const int num_indices = 6 * count;
649 const int size_indices = 4;
650 int cur_index = 0;
651
652 for (i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
653 float minx, miny, maxx, maxy;
654
655 minx = rects[i].x;
656 miny = rects[i].y;
657 maxx = rects[i].x + rects[i].w;
658 maxy = rects[i].y + rects[i].h;
659
660 *ptr_xy++ = minx;
661 *ptr_xy++ = miny;
662 *ptr_xy++ = maxx;
663 *ptr_xy++ = miny;
664 *ptr_xy++ = maxx;
665 *ptr_xy++ = maxy;
666 *ptr_xy++ = minx;
667 *ptr_xy++ = maxy;
668
669 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + rect_index_order[0];
670 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + rect_index_order[1];
671 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + rect_index_order[2];
672 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + rect_index_order[3];
673 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + rect_index_order[4];
674 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + rect_index_order[5];
675 cur_index += 4;
676 }
677
678 result = renderer->QueueGeometry(renderer, cmd, NULL,
679 xy, xy_stride, &renderer->color, 0 /* color_stride */, NULL, 0,
680 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
681 1.0f, 1.0f);
682
683 if (!result) {
684 cmd->command = SDL_RENDERCMD_NO_OP;
685 }
686 }
687 SDL_small_free(xy, isstack1);
688 SDL_small_free(indices, isstack2);
689
690 } else {
691 result = renderer->QueueFillRects(renderer, cmd, rects, count);
692 if (!result) {
693 cmd->command = SDL_RENDERCMD_NO_OP;
694 }
695 }
696 }
697 return result;
698}
SDL_small_alloc
#define SDL_small_alloc(type, count, pisstack)
Definition SDL_internal.h:55
SDL_small_free
#define SDL_small_free(ptr, isstack)
Definition SDL_internal.h:56
rect_index_order
static const int rect_index_order[]
Definition SDL_render.c:156
rects
EGLSurface EGLint * rects
Definition eglext.h:263

Definition SDL_sysrender.h:229

SDL_TextureAddressMode texture_address_mode_u,

static
736{
737 SDL_RenderCommand *cmd;
738 bool result = false;
739 cmd = PrepQueueCmdDraw(renderer, SDL_RENDERCMD_GEOMETRY, texture);
740 if (cmd) {
741 cmd->data.draw.texture_address_mode_u = texture_address_mode_u;
742 cmd->data.draw.texture_address_mode_v = texture_address_mode_v;
743 result = renderer->QueueGeometry(renderer, cmd, texture,
744 xy, xy_stride,
745 color, color_stride, uv, uv_stride,
746 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
747 scale_x, scale_y);
748 if (!result) {
749 cmd->command = SDL_RENDERCMD_NO_OP;
750 }
751 }
752 return result;
753}

References SDL_RenderCommand::command, SDL_RenderCommand::data, SDL_RenderCommand::draw, PrepQueueCmdDraw(), SDL_Renderer::QueueGeometry, SDL_RENDERCMD_GEOMETRY, SDL_RENDERCMD_NO_OP, SDL_RenderCommand::texture_address_mode_u, and SDL_RenderCommand::texture_address_mode_v.

◆ QueueCmdSetClipRect()

bool QueueCmdSetClipRect ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
483{
484 bool result = true;
485
486 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
487 SDL_Rect clip_rect = view->pixel_clip_rect;
488 if (!renderer->cliprect_queued ||
489 view->clipping_enabled != renderer->last_queued_cliprect_enabled ||
490 SDL_memcmp(&clip_rect, &renderer->last_queued_cliprect, sizeof(clip_rect)) != 0) {
491 SDL_RenderCommand *cmd = AllocateRenderCommand(renderer);
492 if (cmd) {
493 cmd->command = SDL_RENDERCMD_SETCLIPRECT;
494 cmd->data.cliprect.enabled = view->clipping_enabled;
495 SDL_copyp(&cmd->data.cliprect.rect, &clip_rect);
496 SDL_copyp(&renderer->last_queued_cliprect, &clip_rect);
497 renderer->last_queued_cliprect_enabled = view->clipping_enabled;
498 renderer->cliprect_queued = true;
499 } else {
500 result = false;
501 }
502 }
503 return result;
504}

507{
508 bool result = true;
509

511 color->r != renderer->last_queued_color.r ||

◆ RenderLineBresenham()

bool RenderLineBresenham ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
int x1,
int y1,
int x2,
int y2,
bool draw_last )
static
3483{
3484 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3485 const int MAX_PIXELS = SDL_max(view->pixel_w, view->pixel_h) * 4;
3486 int i, deltax, deltay, numpixels;
3487 int d, dinc1, dinc2;
3488 int x, xinc1, xinc2;
3489 int y, yinc1, yinc2;
3490 bool result;
3491 bool isstack;
3492 SDL_FPoint *points;
3493 SDL_Rect viewport;
3494
3495 /* the backend might clip this further to the clipping rect, but we
3496 just want a basic safety against generating millions of points for
3497 massive lines. */
3498 viewport = view->pixel_viewport;
3499 viewport.x = 0;
3500 viewport.y = 0;
3501 if (!SDL_GetRectAndLineIntersection(&viewport, &x1, &y1, &x2, &y2)) {
3502 return true;
3503 }
3504
3505 deltax = SDL_abs(x2 - x1);
3506 deltay = SDL_abs(y2 - y1);
3507
3508 if (deltax >= deltay) {
3509 numpixels = deltax + 1;
3510 d = (2 * deltay) - deltax;
3511 dinc1 = deltay * 2;
3512 dinc2 = (deltay - deltax) * 2;
3513 xinc1 = 1;
3514 xinc2 = 1;
3515 yinc1 = 0;
3516 yinc2 = 1;
3517 } else {
3518 numpixels = deltay + 1;
3519 d = (2 * deltax) - deltay;
3520 dinc1 = deltax * 2;
3521 dinc2 = (deltax - deltay) * 2;
3522 xinc1 = 0;
3523 xinc2 = 1;
3524 yinc1 = 1;
3525 yinc2 = 1;
3526 }
3527
3528 if (x1 > x2) {
3529 xinc1 = -xinc1;
3530 xinc2 = -xinc2;
3531 }
3532 if (y1 > y2) {
3533 yinc1 = -yinc1;
3534 yinc2 = -yinc2;
3535 }
3536
3537 x = x1;
3538 y = y1;
3539
3540 if (!draw_last) {
3541 --numpixels;
3542 }
3543
3544 if (numpixels > MAX_PIXELS) {
3545 return SDL_SetError("Line too long (tried to draw %d pixels, max %d)", numpixels, MAX_PIXELS);
3546 }
3547
3548 points = SDL_small_alloc(SDL_FPoint, numpixels, &isstack);
3549 if (!points) {
3550 return false;
3551 }
3552 for (i = 0; i < numpixels; ++i) {
3553 points[i].x = (float)x;
3554 points[i].y = (float)y;
3555
3556 if (d < 0) {
3557 d += dinc1;
3558 x += xinc1;
3559 y += yinc1;
3560 } else {
3561 d += dinc2;
3562 x += xinc2;
3563 y += yinc2;
3564 }
3565 }
3566
3567 if ((view->current_scale.x != 1.0f) || (view->current_scale.y != 1.0f)) {
3568 result = RenderPointsWithRects(renderer, points, numpixels);
3569 } else {
3570 result = QueueCmdDrawPoints(renderer, points, numpixels);
3571 }
3572
3573 SDL_small_free(points, isstack);
3574
3575 return result;
3576}
SDL_SetError
SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetError(SDL_PRINTF_FORMAT_STRING const char *fmt,...) SDL_PRINTF_VARARG_FUNC(1)
Definition SDL_error.c:29

◆ RenderLinesWithRectsF()

bool RenderLinesWithRectsF ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_FPoint * points,
const int count )
static
3579{
3580 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3581 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
3582 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
3583 SDL_FRect *frect;
3584 SDL_FRect *frects;
3585 int i, nrects = 0;
3586 bool result = true;
3587 bool isstack;
3588 bool drew_line = false;
3589 bool draw_last = false;
3590
3591 frects = SDL_small_alloc(SDL_FRect, count - 1, &isstack);
3592 if (!frects) {
3593 return false;
3594 }
3595
3596 for (i = 0; i < count - 1; ++i) {
3597 bool same_x = (points[i].x == points[i + 1].x);
3598 bool same_y = (points[i].y == points[i + 1].y);
3599
3600 if (i == (count - 2)) {
3601 if (!drew_line || points[i + 1].x != points[0].x || points[i + 1].y != points[0].y) {
3602 draw_last = true;
3603 }
3604 } else {
3605 if (same_x && same_y) {
3606 continue;
3607 }
3608 }
3609 if (same_x) {
3610 const float minY = SDL_min(points[i].y, points[i + 1].y);
3611 const float maxY = SDL_max(points[i].y, points[i + 1].y);
3612
3613 frect = &frects[nrects++];
3614 frect->x = points[i].x * scale_x;
3615 frect->y = minY * scale_y;
3616 frect->w = scale_x;
3617 frect->h = (maxY - minY + draw_last) * scale_y;
3618 if (!draw_last && points[i + 1].y < points[i].y) {
3619 frect->y += scale_y;
3620 }
3621 } else if (same_y) {
3622 const float minX = SDL_min(points[i].x, points[i + 1].x);
3623 const float maxX = SDL_max(points[i].x, points[i + 1].x);
3624
3625 frect = &frects[nrects++];
3626 frect->x = minX * scale_x;
3627 frect->y = points[i].y * scale_y;
3628 frect->w = (maxX - minX + draw_last) * scale_x;
3629 frect->h = scale_y;
3630 if (!draw_last && points[i + 1].x < points[i].x) {
3631 frect->x += scale_x;
3632 }
3633 } else {
3634 result &= RenderLineBresenham(renderer, (int)SDL_roundf(points[i].x), (int)SDL_roundf(points[i].y),
3635 (int)SDL_roundf(points[i + 1].x), (int)SDL_roundf(points[i + 1].y), draw_last);
3636 }
3637 drew_line = true;
3638 }
3639
3640 if (nrects) {
3641 result &= QueueCmdFillRects(renderer, frects, nrects);
3642 }
3643
3644 SDL_small_free(frects, isstack);
3645
3646 return result;
3647}

◆ SDL_AddVulkanRenderSemaphores()

bool SDL_AddVulkanRenderSemaphores ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
Uint32 wait_stage_mask,
Sint64 wait_semaphore,
Sint64 signal_semaphore )

Add a set of synchronization semaphores for the current frame.

The Vulkan renderer will wait for wait_semaphore before submitting rendering commands and signal signal_semaphore after rendering commands are complete for this frame.

This should be called each frame that you want semaphore synchronization. The Vulkan renderer may have multiple frames in flight on the GPU, so you should have multiple semaphores that are used for synchronization. Querying SDL_PROP_RENDERER_VULKAN_SWAPCHAIN_IMAGE_COUNT_NUMBER will give you the maximum number of semaphores you'll need.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
wait_stage_maskthe VkPipelineStageFlags for the wait.
wait_semaphorea VkSempahore to wait on before rendering the current frame, or 0 if not needed.
signal_semaphorea VkSempahore that SDL will signal when rendering for the current frame is complete, or 0 if not needed.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
It is NOT safe to call this function from two threads at once.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5625{
5626 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
5627
5628 if (!renderer->AddVulkanRenderSemaphores) {
5629 return SDL_Unsupported();
5630 }
5631 return renderer->AddVulkanRenderSemaphores(renderer, wait_stage_mask, wait_semaphore, signal_semaphore);
5632}
SDL_Unsupported
#define SDL_Unsupported()
Definition SDL_error.h:192
CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC
#define CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, result)
Definition SDL_render.c:58
SDL_Renderer::AddVulkanRenderSemaphores

◆ SDL_AllocateRenderVertices()

void * SDL_AllocateRenderVertices ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
size_t numbytes,
size_t alignment,
size_t * offset )
370{
371 const size_t needed = renderer->vertex_data_used + numbytes + alignment;
372 const size_t current_offset = renderer->vertex_data_used;
373
374 const size_t aligner = (alignment && ((current_offset & (alignment - 1)) != 0)) ? (alignment - (current_offset & (alignment - 1))) : 0;
375 const size_t aligned = current_offset + aligner;
376
377 if (renderer->vertex_data_allocation < needed) {
378 const size_t current_allocation = renderer->vertex_data ? renderer->vertex_data_allocation : 1024;
379 size_t newsize = current_allocation * 2;
380 void *ptr;
381 while (newsize < needed) {
382 newsize *= 2;
383 }
384
385 ptr = SDL_realloc(renderer->vertex_data, newsize);
386
387 if (!ptr) {
388 return NULL;
389 }
390 renderer->vertex_data = ptr;
391 renderer->vertex_data_allocation = newsize;
392 }
393
394 if (offset) {
395 *offset = aligned;
396 }
397
398 renderer->vertex_data_used += aligner + numbytes;
399
400 return ((Uint8 *)renderer->vertex_data) + aligned;
401}
offset
EGLStreamKHR EGLint EGLint offset
Definition eglext.h:1324

size_t vertex_data_allocation
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:327

◆ SDL_CalculateSimulatedVSyncInterval()

void SDL_CalculateSimulatedVSyncInterval ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Window * window )
static
955{
956 SDL_DisplayID displayID = SDL_GetDisplayForWindow(window);
957 const SDL_DisplayMode *mode;
958 int refresh_num, refresh_den;
959
960 if (displayID == 0) {
961 displayID = SDL_GetPrimaryDisplay();
962 }
963 mode = SDL_GetDesktopDisplayMode(displayID);
964 if (mode && mode->refresh_rate_numerator > 0 && mode->refresh_rate_denominator > 0) {
965 refresh_num = mode->refresh_rate_numerator;
966 refresh_den = mode->refresh_rate_denominator;
967 } else {
968 // Pick a good default refresh rate
969 refresh_num = 60;
970 refresh_den = 1;
971 }
972 // Flip numerator and denominator to change from framerate to interval
973 renderer->simulate_vsync_interval_ns = (SDL_NS_PER_SECOND * refresh_den) / refresh_num;
974}
SDL_NS_PER_SECOND
#define SDL_NS_PER_SECOND

◆ SDL_ComposeCustomBlendMode()

SDL_BlendMode SDL_ComposeCustomBlendMode ( SDL_BlendFactor srcColorFactor,
SDL_BlendFactor dstColorFactor,
SDL_BlendOperation colorOperation,
SDL_BlendFactor srcAlphaFactor,
SDL_BlendFactor dstAlphaFactor,
SDL_BlendOperation alphaOperation )

Compose a custom blend mode for renderers.

The functions SDL_SetRenderDrawBlendMode and SDL_SetTextureBlendMode accept the SDL_BlendMode returned by this function if the renderer supports it.

A blend mode controls how the pixels from a drawing operation (source) get combined with the pixels from the render target (destination). First, the components of the source and destination pixels get multiplied with their blend factors. Then, the blend operation takes the two products and calculates the result that will get stored in the render target.

Expressed in pseudocode, it would look like this:

dstRGB = colorOperation(srcRGB * srcColorFactor, dstRGB * dstColorFactor);
dstA = alphaOperation(srcA * srcAlphaFactor, dstA * dstAlphaFactor);

Where the functions colorOperation(src, dst) and alphaOperation(src, dst) can return one of the following:

  • src + dst
  • src - dst
  • dst - src
  • min(src, dst)
  • max(src, dst)

The red, green, and blue components are always multiplied with the first, second, and third components of the SDL_BlendFactor, respectively. The fourth component is not used.

The alpha component is always multiplied with the fourth component of the SDL_BlendFactor. The other components are not used in the alpha calculation.

Support for these blend modes varies for each renderer. To check if a specific SDL_BlendMode is supported, create a renderer and pass it to either SDL_SetRenderDrawBlendMode or SDL_SetTextureBlendMode. They will return with an error if the blend mode is not supported.

This list describes the support of custom blend modes for each renderer. All renderers support the four blend modes listed in the SDL_BlendMode enumeration.

  • direct3d: Supports all operations with all factors. However, some factors produce unexpected results with SDL_BLENDOPERATION_MINIMUM and SDL_BLENDOPERATION_MAXIMUM.
  • direct3d11: Same as Direct3D 9.
  • opengl: Supports the SDL_BLENDOPERATION_ADD operation with all factors. OpenGL versions 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3 do not work correctly here.
  • opengles2: Supports the SDL_BLENDOPERATION_ADD, SDL_BLENDOPERATION_SUBTRACT, SDL_BLENDOPERATION_REV_SUBTRACT operations with all factors.
  • psp: No custom blend mode support.
  • software: No custom blend mode support.

Some renderers do not provide an alpha component for the default render target. The SDL_BLENDFACTOR_DST_ALPHA and SDL_BLENDFACTOR_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA factors do not have an effect in this case.

Parameters
srcColorFactorthe SDL_BlendFactor applied to the red, green, and blue components of the source pixels.
dstColorFactorthe SDL_BlendFactor applied to the red, green, and blue components of the destination pixels.
colorOperationthe SDL_BlendOperation used to combine the red, green, and blue components of the source and destination pixels.
srcAlphaFactorthe SDL_BlendFactor applied to the alpha component of the source pixels.
dstAlphaFactorthe SDL_BlendFactor applied to the alpha component of the destination pixels.
alphaOperationthe SDL_BlendOperation used to combine the alpha component of the source and destination pixels.
Returns
an SDL_BlendMode that represents the chosen factors and operations.
Thread Safety
It is safe to call this function from any thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetRenderDrawBlendMode
SDL_GetRenderDrawBlendMode
SDL_SetTextureBlendMode
SDL_GetTextureBlendMode
5690{
5691 SDL_BlendMode blendMode = SDL_COMPOSE_BLENDMODE(srcColorFactor, dstColorFactor, colorOperation,
5692 srcAlphaFactor, dstAlphaFactor, alphaOperation);
5693 return SDL_GetShortBlendMode(blendMode);
5694}
SDL_GetShortBlendMode
static SDL_BlendMode SDL_GetShortBlendMode(SDL_BlendMode blendMode)
Definition SDL_render.c:5634

◆ SDL_ConvertEventToRenderCoordinates()

bool SDL_ConvertEventToRenderCoordinates ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Event * event )

Convert the coordinates in an event to render coordinates.

This takes into account several states:

  • The window dimensions.
  • The logical presentation settings (SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation)
  • The scale (SDL_SetRenderScale)
  • The viewport (SDL_SetRenderViewport)

Various event types are converted with this function: mouse, touch, pen, etc.

Touch coordinates are converted from normalized coordinates in the window to non-normalized rendering coordinates.

Relative mouse coordinates (xrel and yrel event fields) are also converted. Applications that do not want these fields converted should use SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow() on the specific event fields instead of converting the entire event structure.

Once converted, coordinates may be outside the rendering area.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
eventthe event to modify.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow
2972{
2973 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
2974
2975 if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_MOUSE_MOTION) {
2976 SDL_Window *window = SDL_GetWindowFromID(event->motion.windowID);
2977 if (window == renderer->window) {
2978 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->motion.x, event->motion.y, &event->motion.x, &event->motion.y);
2979 SDL_RenderVectorFromWindow(renderer, event->motion.xrel, event->motion.yrel, &event->motion.xrel, &event->motion.yrel);
2980 }
2981 } else if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON_DOWN ||
2982 event->type == SDL_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON_UP) {
2983 SDL_Window *window = SDL_GetWindowFromID(event->button.windowID);
2984 if (window == renderer->window) {
2985 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->button.x, event->button.y, &event->button.x, &event->button.y);
2986 }
2987 } else if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_MOUSE_WHEEL) {

2990 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->wheel.mouse_x,
2991 event->wheel.mouse_y,
2992 &event->wheel.mouse_x,
2993 &event->wheel.mouse_y);
2994 }
2995 } else if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_FINGER_DOWN ||
2996 event->type == SDL_EVENT_FINGER_UP ||
2997 event->type == SDL_EVENT_FINGER_CANCELED ||
2998 event->type == SDL_EVENT_FINGER_MOTION) {
2999 // FIXME: Are these events guaranteed to be window relative?
3000 if (renderer->window) {
3001 int w, h;
3002 if (!SDL_GetWindowSize(renderer->window, &w, &h)) {
3003 return false;
3004 }
3005 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->tfinger.x * w, event->tfinger.y * h, &event->tfinger.x, &event->tfinger.y);

3007 }
3008 } else if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_PEN_MOTION) {
3009 SDL_Window *window = SDL_GetWindowFromID(event->pmotion.windowID);

3012 }

3016 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->ptouch.x, event->ptouch.y, &event->ptouch.x, &event->ptouch.y);
3017 }
3018 } else if ((event->type == SDL_EVENT_PEN_BUTTON_DOWN) || (event->type == SDL_EVENT_PEN_BUTTON_UP)) {
3019 SDL_Window *window = SDL_GetWindowFromID(event->pbutton.windowID);
3020 if (window == renderer->window) {
3021 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->pbutton.x, event->pbutton.y, &event->pbutton.x, &event->pbutton.y);
3022 }
3023 } else if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_PEN_AXIS) {
3024 SDL_Window *window = SDL_GetWindowFromID(event->paxis.windowID);
3025 if (window == renderer->window) {
3026 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->paxis.x, event->paxis.y, &event->paxis.x, &event->paxis.y);
3027 }
3028 } else if (event->type == SDL_EVENT_DROP_POSITION ||
3029 event->type == SDL_EVENT_DROP_FILE ||
3030 event->type == SDL_EVENT_DROP_TEXT ||
3031 event->type == SDL_EVENT_DROP_COMPLETE) {
3032 SDL_Window *window = SDL_GetWindowFromID(event->drop.windowID);
3033 if (window == renderer->window) {
3034 SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow(renderer, event->drop.x, event->drop.y, &event->drop.x, &event->drop.y);
3035 }
3036 }
3037 return true;
3038}

◆ SDL_CreateGPURenderer()

SDL_Renderer * SDL_CreateGPURenderer ( SDL_Window * window,
SDL_GPUShaderFormat format_flags,
SDL_GPUDevice ** device )

Create a 2D GPU rendering context for a window, with support for the specified shader format.

This is a convenience function to create a SDL GPU backed renderer, intended to be used with SDL_GPURenderState. The resulting renderer will support shaders in one of the specified shader formats.

If no available GPU driver supports any of the specified shader formats, this function will fail.

Parameters
windowthe window where rendering is displayed.
format_flagsa bitflag indicating which shader formats the app is able to provide.
devicea pointer filled with the associated GPU device, or NULL on error.
Returns
a valid rendering context or NULL if there was an error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.4.0.
See also
SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties
SDL_GetGPUShaderFormats
SDL_CreateGPUShader
SDL_CreateGPURenderState
SDL_SetRenderGPUState
1196{
1197 if (!device) {
1198 SDL_InvalidParamError("device");
1199 return NULL;
1200 }
1201
1202 *device = NULL;
1203 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
1204
1205 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_CreateProperties();
1206 SDL_SetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_WINDOW_POINTER, window);
1207 if (format_flags & SDL_GPU_SHADERFORMAT_SPIRV) {
1208 SDL_SetBooleanProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_GPU_SHADERS_SPIRV_BOOLEAN, true);
1209 }
1210 if (format_flags & SDL_GPU_SHADERFORMAT_DXIL) {
1211 SDL_SetBooleanProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_GPU_SHADERS_DXIL_BOOLEAN, true);
1212 }
1213 if (format_flags & SDL_GPU_SHADERFORMAT_MSL) {
1214 SDL_SetBooleanProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_GPU_SHADERS_MSL_BOOLEAN, true);
1215 }
1216 SDL_SetStringProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_NAME_STRING, "gpu");
1217
1218 renderer = SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties(props);
1219 if (renderer) {
1220 *device = (SDL_GPUDevice *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(SDL_GetRendererProperties(renderer), SDL_PROP_RENDERER_GPU_DEVICE_POINTER, NULL);
1221 }
1222 SDL_DestroyProperties(props);
1223 return renderer;
1224}

◆ SDL_CreateGPURenderState()

SDL_GPURenderState * SDL_CreateGPURenderState ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_GPURenderStateDesc * desc )

Create custom GPU render state.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer to use.
descGPU render state description, initialized using SDL_INIT_INTERFACE().
Returns
a custom GPU render state or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should be called on the thread that created the renderer.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.4.0.
See also
SDL_SetGPURenderStateFragmentUniforms
SDL_SetRenderGPUState
SDL_DestroyGPURenderState
5956{
5957 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, NULL);
5958
5959 if (!desc) {
5960 SDL_InvalidParamError("desc");
5961 return NULL;
5962 }
5963
5964 if (desc->version < sizeof(*desc)) {
5965 // Update this to handle older versions of this interface
5966 SDL_SetError("Invalid desc, should be initialized with SDL_INIT_INTERFACE()");
5967 return NULL;
5968 }
5969
5970 if (!desc->fragment_shader) {
5971 SDL_SetError("desc->fragment_shader is required");
5972 return NULL;
5973 }
5974
5975 SDL_GPUDevice *device = (SDL_GPUDevice *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(renderer->props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_GPU_DEVICE_POINTER, NULL);
5976 if (!device) {
5977 SDL_SetError("Renderer isn't associated with a GPU device");
5978 return NULL;
5979 }
5980
5981 SDL_GPURenderState *state = (SDL_GPURenderState *)SDL_calloc(1, sizeof(*state));
5982 if (!state) {
5983 return NULL;
5984 }
5985
5986 state->renderer = renderer;
5987 state->fragment_shader = desc->fragment_shader;
5988
5989 if (desc->num_sampler_bindings > 0) {
5990 state->sampler_bindings = (SDL_GPUTextureSamplerBinding *)SDL_calloc(desc->num_sampler_bindings, sizeof(*state->sampler_bindings));
5991 if (!state->sampler_bindings) {
5992 SDL_DestroyGPURenderState(state);
5993 return NULL;
5994 }
5995 SDL_memcpy(state->sampler_bindings, desc->sampler_bindings, desc->num_sampler_bindings * sizeof(*state->sampler_bindings));
5996 state->num_sampler_bindings = desc->num_sampler_bindings;
5997 }
5998
5999 if (desc->num_storage_textures > 0) {
6000 state->storage_textures = (SDL_GPUTexture **)SDL_calloc(desc->num_storage_textures, sizeof(*state->storage_textures));
6001 if (!state->storage_textures) {
6002 SDL_DestroyGPURenderState(state);
6003 return NULL;
6004 }
6005 SDL_memcpy(state->storage_textures, desc->storage_textures, desc->num_storage_textures * sizeof(*state->storage_textures));
6006 state->num_storage_textures = desc->num_storage_textures;
6007 }
6008
6009 if (desc->num_storage_buffers > 0) {
6010 state->storage_buffers = (SDL_GPUBuffer **)SDL_calloc(desc->num_storage_buffers, sizeof(*state->storage_buffers));
6011 if (!state->storage_buffers) {
6012 SDL_DestroyGPURenderState(state);
6013 return NULL;
6014 }
6015 SDL_memcpy(state->storage_buffers, desc->storage_buffers, desc->num_storage_buffers * sizeof(*state->storage_buffers));
6016 state->num_storage_buffers = desc->num_storage_buffers;
6017 }
6018
6019 return state;
6020}

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_GPURenderState::fragment_shader, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::fragment_shader, NULL, SDL_GPURenderState::num_sampler_bindings, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::num_sampler_bindings, SDL_GPURenderState::num_storage_buffers, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::num_storage_buffers, SDL_GPURenderState::num_storage_textures, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::num_storage_textures, SDL_Renderer::props, SDL_GPURenderState::renderer, SDL_GPURenderState::sampler_bindings, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::sampler_bindings, SDL_calloc(), SDL_DestroyGPURenderState(), SDL_GetPointerProperty(), SDL_InvalidParamError, SDL_memcpy, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_GPU_DEVICE_POINTER, SDL_SetError(), SDL_GPURenderState::storage_buffers, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::storage_buffers, SDL_GPURenderState::storage_textures, SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::storage_textures, and SDL_GPURenderStateDesc::version.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateRenderer()

SDL_Renderer * SDL_CreateRenderer ( SDL_Window * window,
const char * name )

Create a 2D rendering context for a window.

If you want a specific renderer, you can specify its name here. A list of available renderers can be obtained by calling SDL_GetRenderDriver() multiple times, with indices from 0 to SDL_GetNumRenderDrivers()-1. If you don't need a specific renderer, specify NULL and SDL will attempt to choose the best option for you, based on what is available on the user's system.

If name is a comma-separated list, SDL will try each name, in the order listed, until one succeeds or all of them fail.

By default the rendering size matches the window size in pixels, but you can call SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation() to change the content size and scaling options.

Parameters
windowthe window where rendering is displayed.
namethe name of the rendering driver to initialize, or NULL to let SDL choose one.
Returns
a valid rendering context or NULL if there was an error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties
SDL_CreateSoftwareRenderer
SDL_DestroyRenderer
SDL_GetNumRenderDrivers
SDL_GetRenderDriver
SDL_GetRendererName
1185{
1186 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
1187 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_CreateProperties();
1188 SDL_SetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_WINDOW_POINTER, window);
1189 SDL_SetStringProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_NAME_STRING, name);
1190 renderer = SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties(props);
1191 SDL_DestroyProperties(props);
1192 return renderer;
1193}
name
EGLint name
Definition eglext.h:120

Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties()

SDL_Renderer * SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties ( SDL_PropertiesID props)

Create a 2D rendering context for a window, with the specified properties.

These are the supported properties:

  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_NAME_STRING: the name of the rendering driver to use, if a specific one is desired
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_WINDOW_POINTER: the window where rendering is displayed, required if this isn't a software renderer using a surface
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_SURFACE_POINTER: the surface where rendering is displayed, if you want a software renderer without a window
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_OUTPUT_COLORSPACE_NUMBER: an SDL_Colorspace value describing the colorspace for output to the display, defaults to SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB. The direct3d11, direct3d12, and metal renderers support SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR, which is a linear color space and supports HDR output. If you select SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR, drawing still uses the sRGB colorspace, but values can go beyond 1.0 and float (linear) format textures can be used for HDR content.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_PRESENT_VSYNC_NUMBER: non-zero if you want present synchronized with the refresh rate. This property can take any value that is supported by SDL_SetRenderVSync() for the renderer.

With the SDL GPU renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_GPU_SHADERS_SPIRV_BOOLEAN: the app is able to provide SPIR-V shaders to SDL_GPURenderState, optional.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_GPU_SHADERS_DXIL_BOOLEAN: the app is able to provide DXIL shaders to SDL_GPURenderState, optional.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_GPU_SHADERS_MSL_BOOLEAN: the app is able to provide MSL shaders to SDL_GPURenderState, optional.

With the vulkan renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_VULKAN_INSTANCE_POINTER: the VkInstance to use with the renderer, optional.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_VULKAN_SURFACE_NUMBER: the VkSurfaceKHR to use with the renderer, optional.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_VULKAN_PHYSICAL_DEVICE_POINTER: the VkPhysicalDevice to use with the renderer, optional.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_VULKAN_DEVICE_POINTER: the VkDevice to use with the renderer, optional.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_VULKAN_GRAPHICS_QUEUE_FAMILY_INDEX_NUMBER: the queue family index used for rendering.
  • SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_VULKAN_PRESENT_QUEUE_FAMILY_INDEX_NUMBER: the queue family index used for presentation.
Parameters
propsthe properties to use.
Returns
a valid rendering context or NULL if there was an error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateProperties
SDL_CreateRenderer
SDL_CreateSoftwareRenderer
SDL_DestroyRenderer
SDL_GetRendererName
980{
981#ifndef SDL_RENDER_DISABLED
982 SDL_Window *window = (SDL_Window *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_WINDOW_POINTER, NULL);
983 SDL_Surface *surface = (SDL_Surface *)SDL_GetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_SURFACE_POINTER, NULL);
984 const char *driver_name = SDL_GetStringProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_NAME_STRING, NULL);
985 const char *hint;
986 SDL_PropertiesID new_props;
987
988#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_ANDROID
989 if (!Android_WaitActiveAndLockActivity()) {
990 return NULL;
991 }
992#endif
993
994 SDL_Renderer *renderer = (SDL_Renderer *)SDL_calloc(1, sizeof(*renderer));
995 if (!renderer) {
996 goto error;
997 }
998
999 SDL_SetObjectValid(renderer, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_RENDERER, true);
1000
1001 if ((!window && !surface) || (window && surface)) {
1002 SDL_InvalidParamError("window");
1003 goto error;
1004 }
1005
1006 if (window && SDL_WindowHasSurface(window)) {
1007 SDL_SetError("Surface already associated with window");
1008 goto error;
1009 }
1010
1011 if (window && SDL_GetRenderer(window)) {
1012 SDL_SetError("Renderer already associated with window");
1013 goto error;
1014 }
1015
1016 hint = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_RENDER_VSYNC);
1017 if (hint && *hint) {
1018 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_PRESENT_VSYNC_NUMBER, SDL_GetHintBoolean(SDL_HINT_RENDER_VSYNC, true));
1019 }
1020
1021 if (surface) {
1022#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_RENDER_SW
1023 const bool rc = SW_CreateRendererForSurface(renderer, surface, props);
1024#else
1025 const bool rc = SDL_SetError("SDL not built with software renderer");
1026#endif
1027 if (!rc) {
1028 goto error;
1029 }
1030 } else {
1031 bool rc = false;
1032 if (!driver_name) {
1033 driver_name = SDL_GetHint(SDL_HINT_RENDER_DRIVER);
1034 }
1035
1036 if (driver_name && *driver_name != 0) {
1037 const char *driver_attempt = driver_name;
1038 while (driver_attempt && *driver_attempt != 0 && !rc) {
1039 const char *driver_attempt_end = SDL_strchr(driver_attempt, ',');
1040 const size_t driver_attempt_len = (driver_attempt_end) ? (driver_attempt_end - driver_attempt) : SDL_strlen(driver_attempt);
1041
1042 for (int i = 0; render_drivers[i]; i++) {
1043 const SDL_RenderDriver *driver = render_drivers[i];
1044 if ((driver_attempt_len == SDL_strlen(driver->name)) && (SDL_strncasecmp(driver->name, driver_attempt, driver_attempt_len) == 0)) {
1045 rc = driver->CreateRenderer(renderer, window, props);
1046 if (rc) {
1047 break;
1048 }
1049 }
1050 }
1051
1052 driver_attempt = (driver_attempt_end) ? (driver_attempt_end + 1) : NULL;
1053 }
1054 } else {
1055 for (int i = 0; render_drivers[i]; i++) {
1056 const SDL_RenderDriver *driver = render_drivers[i];
1057 rc = driver->CreateRenderer(renderer, window, props);
1058 if (rc) {
1059 break;
1060 }
1061 SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing(renderer);
1062 SDL_zerop(renderer); // make sure we don't leave function pointers from a previous CreateRenderer() in this struct.
1063 }
1064 }
1065
1066 if (rc) {
1067 SDL_DebugLogBackend("render", renderer->name);
1068 } else {
1069 if (driver_name) {
1070 SDL_SetError("%s not available", driver_name);
1071 } else {
1072 SDL_SetError("Couldn't find matching render driver");
1073 }
1074 goto error;
1075 }
1076 }
1077
1078 VerifyDrawQueueFunctions(renderer);
1079
1080 renderer->window = window;
1081 renderer->target_mutex = SDL_CreateMutex();
1082 if (surface) {
1083 renderer->main_view.pixel_w = surface->w;
1084 renderer->main_view.pixel_h = surface->h;
1085 }
1086 renderer->main_view.viewport.w = -1;
1087 renderer->main_view.viewport.h = -1;
1088 renderer->main_view.scale.x = 1.0f;
1089 renderer->main_view.scale.y = 1.0f;
1090 renderer->main_view.logical_scale.x = 1.0f;
1091 renderer->main_view.logical_scale.y = 1.0f;
1092 renderer->main_view.current_scale.x = 1.0f;
1093 renderer->main_view.current_scale.y = 1.0f;
1094 renderer->view = &renderer->main_view;
1095 renderer->dpi_scale.x = 1.0f;
1096 renderer->dpi_scale.y = 1.0f;
1097 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, &renderer->main_view);
1098 UpdatePixelClipRect(renderer, &renderer->main_view);
1099 UpdateMainViewDimensions(renderer);
1100
1101 // new textures start at zero, so we start at 1 so first render doesn't flush by accident.
1102 renderer->render_command_generation = 1;
1103
1104 if (renderer->software) {
1105 // Software renderer always uses line method, for speed
1106 renderer->line_method = SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_LINES;
1107 } else {
1108 renderer->line_method = SDL_GetRenderLineMethod();
1109 }
1110
1111 renderer->scale_mode = SDL_SCALEMODE_LINEAR;
1112
1113 renderer->SDR_white_point = 1.0f;
1114 renderer->HDR_headroom = 1.0f;
1115 renderer->desired_color_scale = 1.0f;
1116 renderer->color_scale = 1.0f;
1117
1118 if (window) {
1119 if (SDL_GetWindowFlags(window) & SDL_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT) {
1120 renderer->transparent_window = true;
1121 }
1122
1123 if (SDL_GetWindowFlags(window) & (SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN | SDL_WINDOW_MINIMIZED)) {
1124 renderer->hidden = true;
1125 }
1126 }
1127
1128 new_props = SDL_GetRendererProperties(renderer);
1129 SDL_SetStringProperty(new_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_NAME_STRING, renderer->name);
1130 if (window) {
1131 SDL_SetPointerProperty(new_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_WINDOW_POINTER, window);
1132 }
1133 if (surface) {
1134 SDL_SetPointerProperty(new_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_SURFACE_POINTER, surface);
1135 }
1136 SDL_SetNumberProperty(new_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_OUTPUT_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, renderer->output_colorspace);
1137 UpdateHDRProperties(renderer);
1138
1139 if (window) {
1140 SDL_SetPointerProperty(SDL_GetWindowProperties(window), SDL_PROP_WINDOW_RENDERER_POINTER, renderer);
1141 SDL_AddWindowRenderer(window, renderer);
1142 }
1143
1144 SDL_SetRenderViewport(renderer, NULL);
1145
1146 if (window) {
1147 SDL_AddWindowEventWatch(SDL_WINDOW_EVENT_WATCH_NORMAL, SDL_RendererEventWatch, renderer);
1148 }
1149
1150 int vsync = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_PRESENT_VSYNC_NUMBER, 0);
1151 SDL_SetRenderVSync(renderer, vsync);
1152 SDL_CalculateSimulatedVSyncInterval(renderer, window);
1153
1154 SDL_LogInfo(SDL_LOG_CATEGORY_RENDER,
1155 "Created renderer: %s", renderer->name);
1156
1157 renderer->next = SDL_renderers;
1158 SDL_renderers = renderer;
1159
1160#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_ANDROID
1161 Android_UnlockActivityMutex();
1162#endif
1163
1164 SDL_ClearError();
1165
1166 return renderer;
1167
1168error:
1169#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_ANDROID
1170 Android_UnlockActivityMutex();
1171#endif
1172
1173 if (renderer) {
1174 SDL_DestroyRenderer(renderer);
1175 }
1176 return NULL;
1177
1178#else
1179 SDL_SetError("SDL not built with rendering support");
1180 return NULL;
1181#endif
1182}

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateSoftwareRenderer()

SDL_Renderer * SDL_CreateSoftwareRenderer ( SDL_Surface * surface)

Create a 2D software rendering context for a surface.

Two other API which can be used to create SDL_Renderer: SDL_CreateRenderer() and SDL_CreateWindowAndRenderer(). These can also create a software renderer, but they are intended to be used with an SDL_Window as the final destination and not an SDL_Surface.

Parameters
surfacethe SDL_Surface structure representing the surface where rendering is done.
Returns
a valid rendering context or NULL if there was an error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_DestroyRenderer
1227{
1228#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_RENDER_SW
1229 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
1230
1231 if (!surface) {
1232 SDL_InvalidParamError("surface");
1233 return NULL;
1234 }
1235
1236 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_CreateProperties();
1237 SDL_SetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_SURFACE_POINTER, surface);
1238 renderer = SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties(props);
1239 SDL_DestroyProperties(props);
1240 return renderer;
1241#else
1242 SDL_SetError("SDL not built with rendering support");
1243 return NULL;
1244#endif // !SDL_RENDER_DISABLED
1245}

References NULL, SDL_CreateProperties(), SDL_CreateRendererWithProperties(), SDL_DestroyProperties(), SDL_InvalidParamError, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_CREATE_SURFACE_POINTER, SDL_SetError(), and SDL_SetPointerProperty().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateTexture()

SDL_Texture * SDL_CreateTexture ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_PixelFormat format,
SDL_TextureAccess access,
int w,
int h )

Create a texture for a rendering context.

The contents of a texture when first created are not defined.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
formatone of the enumerated values in SDL_PixelFormat.
accessone of the enumerated values in SDL_TextureAccess.
wthe width of the texture in pixels.
hthe height of the texture in pixels.
Returns
the created texture or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

1572 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, w);
1573 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, h);
1574 texture = SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties(renderer, props);

1576 return texture;

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateTextureFromSurface()

SDL_Texture * SDL_CreateTextureFromSurface ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Surface * surface )

Create a texture from an existing surface.

The surface is not modified or freed by this function.

The SDL_TextureAccess hint for the created texture is SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC.

The pixel format of the created texture may be different from the pixel format of the surface, and can be queried using the SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_FORMAT_NUMBER property.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
surfacethe SDL_Surface structure containing pixel data used to fill the texture.
Returns
the created texture or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateTexture
SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties
SDL_DestroyTexture
1682{
1683 bool needAlpha;
1684 int i;
1685 SDL_PixelFormat format = SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN;
1686 SDL_Palette *palette;
1687 SDL_Texture *texture;
1688 SDL_PropertiesID props;
1689 SDL_Colorspace surface_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_UNKNOWN;
1690 SDL_Colorspace texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_UNKNOWN;
1691
1692 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, NULL);
1693
1694 if (!SDL_SurfaceValid(surface)) {
1695 SDL_InvalidParamError("SDL_CreateTextureFromSurface(): surface");
1696 return NULL;
1697 }
1698
1699 // See what the best texture format is
1700 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(surface->format) || SDL_SurfaceHasColorKey(surface)) {
1701 needAlpha = true;
1702 } else {
1703 needAlpha = false;
1704 }
1705
1706 // If Palette contains alpha values, promotes to alpha format
1707 palette = SDL_GetSurfacePalette(surface);
1708 if (palette) {
1709 bool is_opaque, has_alpha_channel;
1710 SDL_DetectPalette(palette, &is_opaque, &has_alpha_channel);
1711 if (!is_opaque) {
1712 needAlpha = true;
1713 }
1714 }
1715
1716 // Try to have the best pixel format for the texture
1717 // No alpha, but a colorkey => promote to alpha
1718 if (!SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(surface->format) && SDL_SurfaceHasColorKey(surface)) {
1719 if (surface->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_XRGB8888) {
1720 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1721 if (renderer->texture_formats[i] == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB8888) {
1722 format = SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB8888;
1723 break;
1724 }
1725 }
1726 } else if (surface->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_XBGR8888) {
1727 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1728 if (renderer->texture_formats[i] == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ABGR8888) {
1729 format = SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ABGR8888;
1730 break;
1731 }
1732 }
1733 }
1734 } else {
1735 // Exact match would be fine
1736 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1737 if (renderer->texture_formats[i] == surface->format) {
1738 format = surface->format;
1739 break;
1740 }
1741 }
1742 }
1743
1744 // Look for 10-bit pixel formats if needed
1745 if (format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN && SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(surface->format)) {
1746 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1747 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(renderer->texture_formats[i])) {
1748 format = renderer->texture_formats[i];
1749 break;
1750 }
1751 }
1752 }
1753
1754 // Look for floating point pixel formats if needed
1755 if (format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN &&
1756 (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(surface->format) || SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(surface->format))) {
1757 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1758 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(renderer->texture_formats[i])) {
1759 format = renderer->texture_formats[i];
1760 break;
1761 }
1762 }
1763 }
1764
1765 // Fallback, choose a valid pixel format
1766 if (format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN) {
1767 format = renderer->texture_formats[0];
1768 for (i = 0; i < renderer->num_texture_formats; ++i) {
1769 if (!SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC(renderer->texture_formats[i]) &&
1770 SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(renderer->texture_formats[i]) == needAlpha) {
1771 format = renderer->texture_formats[i];
1772 break;
1773 }
1774 }
1775 }
1776
1777 surface_colorspace = SDL_GetSurfaceColorspace(surface);
1778 texture_colorspace = surface_colorspace;
1779
1780 if (surface_colorspace == SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR ||
1781 SDL_COLORSPACETRANSFER(surface_colorspace) == SDL_TRANSFER_CHARACTERISTICS_PQ) {
1782 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(format)) {
1783 texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR;
1784 } else if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(format)) {
1785 texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_HDR10;
1786 } else {
1787 texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB;
1788 }
1789 }
1790
1791 props = SDL_CreateProperties();
1792 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, texture_colorspace);
1793 if (surface_colorspace == texture_colorspace) {
1794 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT,
1795 SDL_GetSurfaceSDRWhitePoint(surface, surface_colorspace));
1796 }
1797 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT,
1798 SDL_GetSurfaceHDRHeadroom(surface, surface_colorspace));
1799 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_FORMAT_NUMBER, format);
1800 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_ACCESS_NUMBER, SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC);
1801 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, surface->w);
1802 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, surface->h);
1803 texture = SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties(renderer, props);
1804 SDL_DestroyProperties(props);
1805 if (!texture) {
1806 return NULL;
1807 }
1808
1809 if (!SDL_UpdateTextureFromSurface(texture, NULL, surface)) {
1810 SDL_DestroyTexture(texture);
1811 return NULL;
1812 }
1813
1814 return texture;
1815}
SDL_DetectPalette
void SDL_DetectPalette(const SDL_Palette *pal, bool *is_opaque, bool *has_alpha_channel)

#define SDL_COLORSPACETRANSFER(cspace)

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetFloatProperty(SDL_PropertiesID props, const char *name, float value)

SDL_UpdateTextureFromSurface
static bool SDL_UpdateTextureFromSurface(SDL_Texture *texture, SDL_Rect *rect, SDL_Surface *surface)

SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER
#define SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER

@ SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC

SDL_Palette
Definition SDL_pixels.h:1142

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, NULL, SDL_Renderer::num_texture_formats, SDL_COLORSPACE_HDR10, SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB, SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR, SDL_COLORSPACE_UNKNOWN, SDL_COLORSPACETRANSFER, SDL_CreateProperties(), SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties(), SDL_DestroyProperties(), SDL_DestroyTexture(), SDL_DetectPalette(), SDL_GetSurfaceColorspace(), SDL_GetSurfaceHDRHeadroom(), SDL_GetSurfacePalette(), SDL_GetSurfaceSDRWhitePoint(), SDL_InvalidParamError, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ABGR8888, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB8888, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_XBGR8888, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_XRGB8888, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_ACCESS_NUMBER, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_FORMAT_NUMBER, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, SDL_SetFloatProperty(), SDL_SetNumberProperty(), SDL_SurfaceHasColorKey(), SDL_SurfaceValid(), SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC, SDL_TRANSFER_CHARACTERISTICS_PQ, SDL_UpdateTextureFromSurface(), and SDL_Renderer::texture_formats.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties()

SDL_Texture * SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_PropertiesID props )

Create a texture for a rendering context with the specified properties.

These are the supported properties:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER: an SDL_Colorspace value describing the texture colorspace, defaults to SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR for floating point textures, SDL_COLORSPACE_HDR10 for 10-bit textures, SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB for other RGB textures and SDL_COLORSPACE_JPEG for YUV textures.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_FORMAT_NUMBER: one of the enumerated values in SDL_PixelFormat, defaults to the best RGBA format for the renderer
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_ACCESS_NUMBER: one of the enumerated values in SDL_TextureAccess, defaults to SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER: the width of the texture in pixels, required
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER: the height of the texture in pixels, required
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT: for HDR10 and floating point textures, this defines the value of 100% diffuse white, with higher values being displayed in the High Dynamic Range headroom. This defaults to 100 for HDR10 textures and 1.0 for floating point textures.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT: for HDR10 and floating point textures, this defines the maximum dynamic range used by the content, in terms of the SDR white point. This would be equivalent to maxCLL / SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT for HDR10 content. If this is defined, any values outside the range supported by the display will be scaled into the available HDR headroom, otherwise they are clipped.

With the direct3d11 renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_D3D11_TEXTURE_POINTER: the ID3D11Texture2D associated with the texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_D3D11_TEXTURE_U_POINTER: the ID3D11Texture2D associated with the U plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_D3D11_TEXTURE_V_POINTER: the ID3D11Texture2D associated with the V plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.

With the direct3d12 renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_D3D12_TEXTURE_POINTER: the ID3D12Resource associated with the texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_D3D12_TEXTURE_U_POINTER: the ID3D12Resource associated with the U plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_D3D12_TEXTURE_V_POINTER: the ID3D12Resource associated with the V plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.

With the metal renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_METAL_PIXELBUFFER_POINTER: the CVPixelBufferRef associated with the texture, if you want to create a texture from an existing pixel buffer.

With the opengl renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGL_TEXTURE_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGL_TEXTURE_UV_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the UV plane of an NV12 texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGL_TEXTURE_U_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the U plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGL_TEXTURE_V_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the V plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.

With the opengles2 renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGLES2_TEXTURE_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGLES2_TEXTURE_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGLES2_TEXTURE_UV_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the UV plane of an NV12 texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGLES2_TEXTURE_U_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the U plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_OPENGLES2_TEXTURE_V_NUMBER: the GLuint texture associated with the V plane of a YUV texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.

With the vulkan renderer:

  • SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_VULKAN_TEXTURE_NUMBER: the VkImage with layout VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_SHADER_READ_ONLY_OPTIMAL associated with the texture, if you want to wrap an existing texture.
Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
propsthe properties to use.
Returns
the created texture or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateProperties
SDL_CreateTexture
SDL_CreateTextureFromSurface
SDL_DestroyTexture
SDL_GetTextureSize
SDL_UpdateTexture
1398{
1399 SDL_Texture *texture;
1400 SDL_PixelFormat format = (SDL_PixelFormat)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_FORMAT_NUMBER, SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN);
1401 SDL_TextureAccess access = (SDL_TextureAccess)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_ACCESS_NUMBER, SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC);
1402 int w = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, 0);
1403 int h = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, 0);
1404 SDL_Colorspace default_colorspace;
1405 bool texture_is_fourcc_and_target;
1406
1407 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, NULL);
1408
1409 if (!format) {
1410 format = renderer->texture_formats[0];
1411 }
1412 if (SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL(format) == 0) {
1413 SDL_SetError("Invalid texture format");
1414 return NULL;
1415 }
1416 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_INDEXED(format)) {
1417 if (!IsSupportedFormat(renderer, format)) {
1418 SDL_SetError("Palettized textures are not supported");
1419 return NULL;
1420 }
1421 }
1422 if (w <= 0 || h <= 0) {
1423 SDL_SetError("Texture dimensions can't be 0");
1424 return NULL;
1425 }
1426 int max_texture_size = (int)SDL_GetNumberProperty(SDL_GetRendererProperties(renderer), SDL_PROP_RENDERER_MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE_NUMBER, 0);
1427 if (max_texture_size && (w > max_texture_size || h > max_texture_size)) {
1428 SDL_SetError("Texture dimensions are limited to %dx%d", max_texture_size, max_texture_size);
1429 return NULL;
1430 }
1431
1432 default_colorspace = SDL_GetDefaultColorspaceForFormat(format);
1433
1434 texture = (SDL_Texture *)SDL_calloc(1, sizeof(*texture));
1435 if (!texture) {
1436 return NULL;
1437 }
1438 texture->refcount = 1;
1439 SDL_SetObjectValid(texture, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_TEXTURE, true);
1440 texture->colorspace = (SDL_Colorspace)SDL_GetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, default_colorspace);
1441 texture->format = format;
1442 texture->access = access;
1443 texture->w = w;
1444 texture->h = h;
1445 texture->color.r = 1.0f;
1446 texture->color.g = 1.0f;
1447 texture->color.b = 1.0f;
1448 texture->color.a = 1.0f;
1449 texture->blendMode = SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(format) ? SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND : SDL_BLENDMODE_NONE;
1450 texture->scaleMode = renderer->scale_mode;
1451 texture->view.pixel_w = w;
1452 texture->view.pixel_h = h;
1453 texture->view.viewport.w = -1;
1454 texture->view.viewport.h = -1;
1455 texture->view.scale.x = 1.0f;
1456 texture->view.scale.y = 1.0f;
1457 texture->view.logical_scale.x = 1.0f;
1458 texture->view.logical_scale.y = 1.0f;
1459 texture->view.current_scale.x = 1.0f;
1460 texture->view.current_scale.y = 1.0f;
1461 texture->renderer = renderer;
1462 texture->next = renderer->textures;
1463 if (renderer->textures) {
1464 renderer->textures->prev = texture;
1465 }
1466 renderer->textures = texture;
1467
1468 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, &texture->view);
1469 UpdatePixelClipRect(renderer, &texture->view);
1470
1471 texture->SDR_white_point = SDL_GetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT, SDL_GetDefaultSDRWhitePoint(texture->colorspace));
1472 texture->HDR_headroom = SDL_GetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, SDL_GetDefaultHDRHeadroom(texture->colorspace));
1473
1474 // FOURCC format cannot be used directly by renderer back-ends for target texture
1475 texture_is_fourcc_and_target = (access == SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET && SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC(format));
1476
1477 if (!texture_is_fourcc_and_target && IsSupportedFormat(renderer, format)) {
1478 if (!renderer->CreateTexture(renderer, texture, props)) {
1479 SDL_DestroyTexture(texture);
1480 return NULL;
1481 }
1482 } else {
1483 SDL_PixelFormat closest_format;
1484 SDL_PropertiesID native_props = SDL_CreateProperties();
1485
1486 if (!texture_is_fourcc_and_target) {
1487 closest_format = GetClosestSupportedFormat(renderer, format);
1488 } else {
1489 closest_format = renderer->texture_formats[0];
1490 }
1491
1492 if (format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_MJPG && closest_format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV12) {
1493 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, SDL_COLORSPACE_JPEG);
1494 } else {
1495 default_colorspace = SDL_GetDefaultColorspaceForFormat(closest_format);
1496 if (SDL_COLORSPACETYPE(texture->colorspace) == SDL_COLORSPACETYPE(default_colorspace)) {
1497 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, texture->colorspace);
1498 } else {
1499 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, default_colorspace);
1500 }
1501 }
1502 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_FORMAT_NUMBER, closest_format);
1503 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_ACCESS_NUMBER, texture->access);
1504 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_WIDTH_NUMBER, texture->w);
1505 SDL_SetNumberProperty(native_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_CREATE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, texture->h);
1506
1507 texture->native = SDL_CreateTextureWithProperties(renderer, native_props);
1508 SDL_DestroyProperties(native_props);
1509 if (!texture->native) {
1510 SDL_DestroyTexture(texture);
1511 return NULL;
1512 }
1513
1514 SDL_SetPointerProperty(SDL_GetTextureProperties(texture->native), SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_PARENT_POINTER, texture);
1515
1516 // Swap textures to have texture before texture->native in the list
1517 texture->native->next = texture->next;
1518 if (texture->native->next) {
1519 texture->native->next->prev = texture->native;
1520 }
1521 texture->prev = texture->native->prev;
1522 if (texture->prev) {
1523 texture->prev->next = texture;
1524 }
1525 texture->native->prev = texture;
1526 texture->next = texture->native;
1527 renderer->textures = texture;
1528
1529 if (texture->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_MJPG) {
1530 // We have a custom decode + upload path for this
1531 } else if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FOURCC(texture->format)) {
1532#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
1533 texture->yuv = SDL_SW_CreateYUVTexture(texture->format, texture->colorspace, w, h);
1534#else
1535 SDL_SetError("SDL not built with YUV support");
1536#endif
1537 if (!texture->yuv) {
1538 SDL_DestroyTexture(texture);
1539 return NULL;
1540 }
1541 } else if (access == SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING) {
1542 // The pitch is 4 byte aligned
1543 texture->pitch = (((w * SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL(format)) + 3) & ~3);
1544 texture->pixels = SDL_calloc(1, (size_t)texture->pitch * h);
1545 if (!texture->pixels) {
1546 SDL_DestroyTexture(texture);
1547 return NULL;
1548 }
1549 }
1550 }
1551
1552 // Now set the properties for the new texture
1553 props = SDL_GetTextureProperties(texture);
1554 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_COLORSPACE_NUMBER, texture->colorspace);
1555 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_FORMAT_NUMBER, texture->format);
1556 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_ACCESS_NUMBER, texture->access);
1557 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_WIDTH_NUMBER, texture->w);
1558 SDL_SetNumberProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_HEIGHT_NUMBER, texture->h);
1559 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT, texture->SDR_white_point);
1560 if (texture->HDR_headroom > 0.0f) {
1561 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, texture->HDR_headroom);
1562 }
1563 return texture;
1564}

SDL_Colorspace SDL_GetDefaultColorspaceForFormat(SDL_PixelFormat format)

◆ SDL_CreateWindowAndRenderer()

bool SDL_CreateWindowAndRenderer ( const char * title,
int width,
int height,
SDL_WindowFlags window_flags,
SDL_Window ** window,
SDL_Renderer ** renderer )

Create a window and default renderer.

Parameters
titlethe title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding.
widththe width of the window.
heightthe height of the window.
window_flagsthe flags used to create the window (see SDL_CreateWindow()).
windowa pointer filled with the window, or NULL on error.
renderera pointer filled with the renderer, or NULL on error.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateRenderer
SDL_CreateWindow
887{
888 bool hidden = (window_flags & SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN) != 0;
889
890 if (!window) {
891 return SDL_InvalidParamError("window");
892 }
893
894 if (!renderer) {
895 return SDL_InvalidParamError("renderer");
896 }
897
898 // Hide the window so if the renderer recreates it, we don't get a visual flash on screen
899 window_flags |= SDL_WINDOW_HIDDEN;
900 *window = SDL_CreateWindow(title, width, height, window_flags);
901 if (!*window) {
902 *renderer = NULL;
903 return false;
904 }
905
906 *renderer = SDL_CreateRenderer(*window, NULL);
907 if (!*renderer) {
908 SDL_DestroyWindow(*window);
909 *window = NULL;
910 return false;
911 }
912
913 if (!hidden) {
914 SDL_ShowWindow(*window);
915 }
916
917 return true;
918}

◆ SDL_DestroyRenderer()

void SDL_DestroyRenderer ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)

Destroy the rendering context for a window and free all associated textures.

This should be called before destroying the associated window.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateRenderer
5572{
5573 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC_BUT_NOT_DESTROYED_FLAG(renderer,);
5574
5575 // if we've already destroyed the renderer through SDL_DestroyWindow, we just need
5576 // to free the renderer pointer. This lets apps destroy the window and renderer
5577 // in either order.
5578 if (!renderer->destroyed) {
5579 SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing(renderer);
5580 }
5581
5582 SDL_Renderer *curr = SDL_renderers;
5583 SDL_Renderer *prev = NULL;
5584 while (curr) {
5585 if (curr == renderer) {
5586 if (prev) {
5587 prev->next = renderer->next;
5588 } else {
5589 SDL_renderers = renderer->next;
5590 }
5591 break;
5592 }
5593 prev = curr;
5594 curr = curr->next;
5595 }
5596
5597 SDL_SetObjectValid(renderer, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_RENDERER, false); // It's no longer magical...
5598
5599 SDL_free(renderer);
5600}
SDL_Renderer::destroyed
bool destroyed

◆ SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing()

void SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
5514{
5515 SDL_assert(renderer != NULL);
5516 SDL_assert(!renderer->destroyed);
5517
5518 renderer->destroyed = true;
5519
5520 SDL_RemoveWindowEventWatch(SDL_WINDOW_EVENT_WATCH_NORMAL, SDL_RendererEventWatch, renderer);
5521
5522 if (renderer->window) {
5523 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_GetWindowProperties(renderer->window);
5524 if (SDL_GetPointerProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_RENDERER_POINTER, NULL) == renderer) {
5525 SDL_ClearProperty(props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_RENDERER_POINTER);
5526 }
5527 SDL_RemoveWindowRenderer(renderer->window, renderer);
5528 }
5529
5530 if (renderer->software) {
5531 // Make sure all drawing to a surface is complete
5532 FlushRenderCommands(renderer);
5533 }
5534 SDL_DiscardAllCommands(renderer);
5535
5536 if (renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas) {
5537 SDL_DestroyTexture(renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas);
5538 renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas = NULL;
5539 }
5540
5541 // Free existing textures for this renderer
5542 while (renderer->textures) {
5543 SDL_Texture *tex = renderer->textures;
5544 SDL_DestroyTextureInternal(renderer->textures, true /* is_destroying */);
5545 SDL_assert(tex != renderer->textures); // satisfy static analysis.
5546 }
5547
5548 // Clean up renderer-specific resources
5549 if (renderer->DestroyRenderer) {
5550 renderer->DestroyRenderer(renderer);
5551 }
5552
5553 if (renderer->target_mutex) {
5554 SDL_DestroyMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
5555 renderer->target_mutex = NULL;
5556 }
5557 if (renderer->vertex_data) {
5558 SDL_free(renderer->vertex_data);
5559 renderer->vertex_data = NULL;
5560 }
5561 if (renderer->texture_formats) {
5562 SDL_free(renderer->texture_formats);
5563 renderer->texture_formats = NULL;
5564 }
5565 if (renderer->props) {
5566 SDL_DestroyProperties(renderer->props);
5567 renderer->props = 0;
5568 }
5569}
SDL_DestroyMutex
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_DestroyMutex(SDL_Mutex *mutex)

◆ SDL_DestroyTextureInternal()

void SDL_DestroyTextureInternal ( SDL_Texture * texture,
bool is_destroying )
static
5434{
5435 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
5436
5437 SDL_DestroyProperties(texture->props);
5438
5439 renderer = texture->renderer;
5440 if (is_destroying) {
5441 // Renderer get destroyed, avoid to queue more commands
5442 } else {
5443 if (texture == renderer->target) {
5444 SDL_SetRenderTarget(renderer, NULL); // implies command queue flush
5445 } else {
5446 FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture);
5447 }
5448 }
5449
5450 SDL_SetObjectValid(texture, SDL_OBJECT_TYPE_TEXTURE, false);
5451
5452 if (texture->next) {
5453 texture->next->prev = texture->prev;
5454 }
5455 if (texture->prev) {
5456 texture->prev->next = texture->next;
5457 } else {
5458 renderer->textures = texture->next;
5459 }
5460
5461 if (texture->native) {
5462 SDL_DestroyTextureInternal(texture->native, is_destroying);
5463 }
5464#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
5465 if (texture->yuv) {
5466 SDL_SW_DestroyYUVTexture(texture->yuv);
5467 }
5468#endif
5469 SDL_free(texture->pixels);
5470
5471 renderer->DestroyTexture(renderer, texture);
5472
5473 SDL_DestroySurface(texture->locked_surface);
5474 texture->locked_surface = NULL;
5475
5476 SDL_free(texture);
5477}

◆ SDL_DiscardAllCommands()

void SDL_DiscardAllCommands ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
5491{
5492 SDL_RenderCommand *cmd;
5493
5494 if (renderer->render_commands_tail) {
5495 renderer->render_commands_tail->next = renderer->render_commands_pool;
5496 cmd = renderer->render_commands;
5497 } else {
5498 cmd = renderer->render_commands_pool;
5499 }
5500
5501 renderer->render_commands_pool = NULL;
5502 renderer->render_commands_tail = NULL;
5503 renderer->render_commands = NULL;
5504 renderer->vertex_data_used = 0;
5505
5506 while (cmd) {
5507 SDL_RenderCommand *next = cmd->next;
5508 SDL_free(cmd);
5509 cmd = next;
5510 }
5511}

References SDL_RenderCommand::next, NULL, SDL_Renderer::render_commands, SDL_Renderer::render_commands_pool, SDL_Renderer::render_commands_tail, SDL_free(), and SDL_Renderer::vertex_data_used.

Referenced by SDL_DestroyRendererWithoutFreeing().

Here is the call graph for this function:
