◆ SDL_RenderTextureRotated()

bool SDL_RenderTextureRotated ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect,
double angle,
const SDL_FPoint * center,
SDL_FlipMode flip )

Copy a portion of the source texture to the current rendering target, with rotation and flipping, at subpixel precision.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrecta pointer to the source rectangle, or NULL for the entire texture.
dstrecta pointer to the destination rectangle, or NULL for the entire rendering target.
anglean angle in degrees that indicates the rotation that will be applied to dstrect, rotating it in a clockwise direction.
centera pointer to a point indicating the point around which dstrect will be rotated (if NULL, rotation will be done around dstrect.w/2, dstrect.h/2).
flipan SDL_FlipMode value stating which flipping actions should be performed on the texture.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture
4137{
4138 SDL_FRect real_srcrect;
4139 SDL_FPoint real_center;
4140 bool result;
4141
4142 if (flip == SDL_FLIP_NONE && (int)(angle / 360) == angle / 360) { // fast path when we don't need rotation or flipping
4143 return SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, srcrect, dstrect);
4144 }
4145
4146 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
4147 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
4148
4149 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
4150 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
4151 }
4152 if (!renderer->QueueCopyEx && !renderer->QueueGeometry) {
4153 return SDL_SetError("Renderer does not support RenderCopyEx");
4154 }
4155
4156#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
4157 // Don't draw while we're hidden
4158 if (renderer->hidden) {
4159 return true;
4160 }
4161#endif
4162
4163 real_srcrect.x = 0.0f;
4164 real_srcrect.y = 0.0f;
4165 real_srcrect.w = (float)texture->w;
4166 real_srcrect.h = (float)texture->h;
4167 if (srcrect) {
4168 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(srcrect, &real_srcrect, &real_srcrect)) {
4169 return true;
4170 }
4171 }
4172
4173 // We don't intersect the dstrect with the viewport as RenderCopy does because of potential rotation clipping issues... TODO: should we?
4174 SDL_FRect full_dstrect;
4175 if (!dstrect) {
4176 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &full_dstrect);
4177 dstrect = &full_dstrect;
4178 }
4179
4180 if (texture->native) {
4181 texture = texture->native;
4182 }
4183
4184 if (center) {
4185 real_center = *center;
4186 } else {
4187 real_center.x = dstrect->w / 2.0f;
4188 real_center.y = dstrect->h / 2.0f;
4189 }
4190
4191 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
4192
4193 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
4194 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
4195 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
4196
4197 const bool use_rendergeometry = (!renderer->QueueCopyEx);
4198 if (use_rendergeometry) {
4199 float xy[8];
4200 const int xy_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
4201 float uv[8];
4202 const int uv_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
4203 const int num_vertices = 4;
4204 const int *indices = rect_index_order;
4205 const int num_indices = 6;
4206 const int size_indices = 4;
4207 float minu, minv, maxu, maxv;
4208 float minx, miny, maxx, maxy;
4209 float centerx, centery;
4210
4211 float s_minx, s_miny, s_maxx, s_maxy;
4212 float c_minx, c_miny, c_maxx, c_maxy;
4213
4214 const float radian_angle = (float)((SDL_PI_D * angle) / 180.0);
4215 const float s = SDL_sinf(radian_angle);
4216 const float c = SDL_cosf(radian_angle);
4217
4218 minu = real_srcrect.x / texture->w;
4219 minv = real_srcrect.y / texture->h;
4220 maxu = (real_srcrect.x + real_srcrect.w) / texture->w;
4221 maxv = (real_srcrect.y + real_srcrect.h) / texture->h;
4222
4223 centerx = real_center.x + dstrect->x;
4224 centery = real_center.y + dstrect->y;
4225
4226 if (flip & SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL) {
4227 minx = dstrect->x + dstrect->w;
4228 maxx = dstrect->x;
4229 } else {
4230 minx = dstrect->x;
4231 maxx = dstrect->x + dstrect->w;
4232 }
4233
4234 if (flip & SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL) {
4235 miny = dstrect->y + dstrect->h;
4236 maxy = dstrect->y;
4237 } else {
4238 miny = dstrect->y;
4239 maxy = dstrect->y + dstrect->h;
4240 }
4241
4242 uv[0] = minu;
4243 uv[1] = minv;
4244 uv[2] = maxu;
4245 uv[3] = minv;
4246 uv[4] = maxu;
4247 uv[5] = maxv;
4248 uv[6] = minu;
4249 uv[7] = maxv;
4250
4251 /* apply rotation with 2x2 matrix ( c -s )
4252 * ( s c ) */
4253 s_minx = s * (minx - centerx);
4254 s_miny = s * (miny - centery);
4255 s_maxx = s * (maxx - centerx);
4256 s_maxy = s * (maxy - centery);
4257 c_minx = c * (minx - centerx);
4258 c_miny = c * (miny - centery);
4259 c_maxx = c * (maxx - centerx);
4260 c_maxy = c * (maxy - centery);
4261
4262 // (minx, miny)
4263 xy[0] = (c_minx - s_miny) + centerx;
4264 xy[1] = (s_minx + c_miny) + centery;
4265 // (maxx, miny)
4266 xy[2] = (c_maxx - s_miny) + centerx;
4267 xy[3] = (s_maxx + c_miny) + centery;
4268 // (maxx, maxy)
4269 xy[4] = (c_maxx - s_maxy) + centerx;
4270 xy[5] = (s_maxx + c_maxy) + centery;
4271 // (minx, maxy)
4272 xy[6] = (c_minx - s_maxy) + centerx;
4273 xy[7] = (s_minx + c_maxy) + centery;
4274
4275 result = QueueCmdGeometry(renderer, texture,
4276 xy, xy_stride, &texture->color, 0 /* color_stride */, uv, uv_stride,
4277 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
4278 scale_x, scale_y, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP);
4279 } else {
4280 result = QueueCmdCopyEx(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, dstrect, angle, &real_center, flip, scale_x, scale_y);
4281 }
4282 return result;
4283}

◆ SDL_RenderTextureTiled()

bool SDL_RenderTextureTiled ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
float scale,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect )

Tile a portion of the texture to the current rendering target at subpixel precision.

The pixels in srcrect will be repeated as many times as needed to completely fill dstrect.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrecta pointer to the source rectangle, or NULL for the entire texture.
scalethe scale used to transform srcrect into the destination rectangle, e.g. a 32x32 texture with a scale of 2 would fill 64x64 tiles.
dstrecta pointer to the destination rectangle, or NULL for the entire rendering target.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture
4394{
4395 SDL_FRect real_srcrect;
4396
4397 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
4398 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
4399
4400 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
4401 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
4402 }
4403
4404 if (scale <= 0.0f) {
4405 return SDL_InvalidParamError("scale");
4406 }
4407
4408#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
4409 // Don't draw while we're hidden
4410 if (renderer->hidden) {
4411 return true;
4412 }
4413#endif
4414
4415 real_srcrect.x = 0.0f;
4416 real_srcrect.y = 0.0f;
4417 real_srcrect.w = (float)texture->w;
4418 real_srcrect.h = (float)texture->h;
4419 if (srcrect) {
4420 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(srcrect, &real_srcrect, &real_srcrect)) {
4421 return true;
4422 }
4423 }
4424
4425 SDL_FRect full_dstrect;
4426 if (!dstrect) {
4427 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &full_dstrect);
4428 dstrect = &full_dstrect;
4429 }
4430
4431 if (texture->native) {
4432 texture = texture->native;
4433 }
4434
4435 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
4436
4437 // See if we can use geometry with repeating texture coordinates
4438 if (!renderer->software &&
4439 (!srcrect ||
4440 (real_srcrect.x == 0.0f && real_srcrect.y == 0.0f &&
4441 real_srcrect.w == (float)texture->w && real_srcrect.h == (float)texture->h))) {
4442 return SDL_RenderTextureTiled_Wrap(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, scale, dstrect);
4443 } else {
4444 return SDL_RenderTextureTiled_Iterate(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, scale, dstrect);
4445 }
4446}

◆ SDL_RenderTextureTiled_Iterate()

bool SDL_RenderTextureTiled_Iterate ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
float scale,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect )
static
4335{
4336 float tile_width = srcrect->w * scale;
4337 float tile_height = srcrect->h * scale;
4338 float float_rows, float_cols;
4339 float remaining_w = SDL_modff(dstrect->w / tile_width, &float_cols);
4340 float remaining_h = SDL_modff(dstrect->h / tile_height, &float_rows);
4341 float remaining_src_w = remaining_w * srcrect->w;
4342 float remaining_src_h = remaining_h * srcrect->h;
4343 float remaining_dst_w = remaining_w * tile_width;
4344 float remaining_dst_h = remaining_h * tile_height;
4345 int rows = (int)float_rows;
4346 int cols = (int)float_cols;
4347 SDL_FRect curr_src, curr_dst;
4348
4349 SDL_copyp(&curr_src, srcrect);
4350 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y;
4351 curr_dst.w = tile_width;
4352 curr_dst.h = tile_height;
4353 for (int y = 0; y < rows; ++y) {
4354 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x;
4355 for (int x = 0; x < cols; ++x) {
4356 if (!SDL_RenderTextureInternal(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4357 return false;
4358 }
4359 curr_dst.x += curr_dst.w;
4360 }
4361 if (remaining_dst_w > 0.0f) {
4362 curr_src.w = remaining_src_w;
4363 curr_dst.w = remaining_dst_w;
4364 if (!SDL_RenderTextureInternal(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4365 return false;
4366 }
4367 curr_src.w = srcrect->w;
4368 curr_dst.w = tile_width;
4369 }
4370 curr_dst.y += curr_dst.h;
4371 }
4372 if (remaining_dst_h > 0.0f) {
4373 curr_src.h = remaining_src_h;
4374 curr_dst.h = remaining_dst_h;
4375 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x;
4376 for (int x = 0; x < cols; ++x) {
4377 if (!SDL_RenderTextureInternal(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4378 return false;
4379 }
4380 curr_dst.x += curr_dst.w;
4381 }
4382 if (remaining_dst_w > 0.0f) {
4383 curr_src.w = remaining_src_w;
4384 curr_dst.w = remaining_dst_w;
4385 if (!SDL_RenderTextureInternal(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4386 return false;
4387 }
4388 }
4389 }
4390 return true;
4391}

◆ SDL_RenderVectorFromWindow()

bool SDL_RenderVectorFromWindow ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float window_dx,
float window_dy,
float * dx,
float * dy )
static
2889{
2890 // Convert from window coordinates to pixels within the window
2891 window_dx *= renderer->dpi_scale.x;
2892 window_dy *= renderer->dpi_scale.y;
2893
2894 // Convert from pixels within the window to pixels within the view
2895 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = &renderer->main_view;
2896 if (view->logical_presentation_mode != SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED) {
2897 const SDL_FRect *src = &view->logical_src_rect;
2898 const SDL_FRect *dst = &view->logical_dst_rect;
2899 window_dx = (window_dx * src->w) / dst->w;
2900 window_dy = (window_dy * src->h) / dst->h;
2901 }
2902
2903 window_dx /= view->scale.x;
2904 window_dy /= view->scale.y;
2905
2906 *dx = window_dx;
2907 *dy = window_dy;
2908 return true;
2909}

◆ SDL_RenderViewportSet()

bool SDL_RenderViewportSet ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)

Return whether an explicit rectangle was set as the viewport.

This is useful if you're saving and restoring the viewport and want to know whether you should restore a specific rectangle or NULL.

Each render target has its own viewport. This function checks the viewport for the current render target.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
Returns
true if the viewport was set to a specific rectangle, or false if it was set to NULL (the entire target).
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderViewport
SDL_SetRenderViewport
3086{
3087 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3088
3089 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3090 return (view->viewport.w >= 0 && view->viewport.h >= 0);
3091}

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_Rect::h, SDL_Renderer::view, SDL_RenderViewState::viewport, and SDL_Rect::w.

bool SDL_SetDefaultTextureScaleMode ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,

Set default scale mode for new textures for given renderer.

When a renderer is created, scale_mode defaults to SDL_SCALEMODE_LINEAR.

◆ SDL_SetGPURenderStateFragmentUniforms()

bool SDL_SetGPURenderStateFragmentUniforms ( SDL_GPURenderState * state,
Uint32 slot_index,
const void * data,
Uint32 length )

Set fragment shader uniform variables in a custom GPU render state.

The data is copied and will be pushed using SDL_PushGPUFragmentUniformData() during draw call execution.

Parameters
statethe state to modify.
slot_indexthe fragment uniform slot to push data to.
dataclient data to write.
lengththe length of the data to write.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should be called on the thread that created the renderer.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.4.0.
6023{
6024 if (!state) {
6025 return SDL_InvalidParamError("state");
6026 }
6027
6028 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfGPURenderStateNeeded(state)) {
6029 return false;
6030 }
6031
6032 for (int i = 0; i < state->num_uniform_buffers; i++) {
6033 SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *buffer = &state->uniform_buffers[i];
6034 if (buffer->slot_index == slot_index) {
6035 void *new_data = SDL_realloc(buffer->data, length);
6036 if (!new_data) {
6037 return false;
6038 }
6039 SDL_memcpy(new_data, data, length);
6040 buffer->data = new_data;
6041 buffer->length = length;
6042 return true;
6043 }
6044 }
6045
6046 SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *buffers = (SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *)SDL_realloc(state->uniform_buffers, (state->num_uniform_buffers + 1) * sizeof(*state->uniform_buffers));
6047 if (!buffers) {
6048 return false;
6049 }
6050
6051 SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *buffer = &buffers[state->num_uniform_buffers];
6052 buffer->slot_index = slot_index;
6053 buffer->length = length;
6054 buffer->data = SDL_malloc(length);
6055 if (!buffer->data) {
6056 SDL_free(buffers);
6057 return false;
6058 }
6059 SDL_memcpy(buffer->data, data, length);
6060
6061 state->uniform_buffers = buffers;
6062 ++state->num_uniform_buffers;
6063 return true;
6064}
SDL_malloc
SDL_DECLSPEC SDL_MALLOC void *SDLCALL SDL_malloc(size_t size)
Definition SDL_malloc.c:6444
buffer
EGLSurface EGLint buffer
Definition egl.h:174
data
EGLStreamKHR EGLint EGLint EGLint const void * data
Definition eglext.h:1324
SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:115

◆ SDL_SetRenderColorScale()

bool SDL_SetRenderColorScale ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float scale )

Set the color scale used for render operations.

The color scale is an additional scale multiplied into the pixel color value while rendering. This can be used to adjust the brightness of colors during HDR rendering, or changing HDR video brightness when playing on an SDR display.

The color scale does not affect the alpha channel, only the color brightness.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
scalethe color scale value.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

◆ SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation()

bool SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
int w,
int h,
SDL_RendererLogicalPresentation mode )

Set a device-independent resolution and presentation mode for rendering.

This function sets the width and height of the logical rendering output. The renderer will act as if the current render target is always the requested dimensions, scaling to the actual resolution as necessary.

This can be useful for games that expect a fixed size, but would like to scale the output to whatever is available, regardless of how a user resizes a window, or if the display is high DPI.

Logical presentation can be used with both render target textures and the renderer's window; the state is unique to each render target, and this function sets the state for the current render target. It might be useful to draw to a texture that matches the window dimensions with logical presentation enabled, and then draw that texture across the entire window with logical presentation disabled. Be careful not to render both with logical presentation enabled, however, as this could produce double-letterboxing, etc.

You can disable logical coordinates by setting the mode to SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED, and in that case you get the full pixel resolution of the render target; it is safe to toggle logical presentation during the rendering of a frame: perhaps most of the rendering is done to specific dimensions but to make fonts look sharp, the app turns off logical presentation while drawing text, for example.

For the renderer's window, letterboxing is drawn into the framebuffer if logical presentation is enabled during SDL_RenderPresent; be sure to reenable it before presenting if you were toggling it, otherwise the letterbox areas might have artifacts from previous frames (or artifacts from external overlays, etc). Letterboxing is never drawn into texture render targets; be sure to call SDL_RenderClear() before drawing into the texture so the letterboxing areas are cleared, if appropriate.

You can convert coordinates in an event into rendering coordinates using SDL_ConvertEventToRenderCoordinates().

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
wthe width of the logical resolution.
hthe height of the logical resolution.
modethe presentation mode used.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_ConvertEventToRenderCoordinates
SDL_GetRenderLogicalPresentation
SDL_GetRenderLogicalPresentationRect
2753{
2754 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
2755
2756 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
2757 view->logical_presentation_mode = mode;
2758 view->logical_w = w;
2759 view->logical_h = h;
2760
2761 UpdateLogicalPresentation(renderer);
2762
2763 return true;
2764}

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_h, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_presentation_mode, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_w, UpdateLogicalPresentation(), and SDL_Renderer::view.

◆ SDL_SetRenderScale()

bool SDL_SetRenderScale ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float scaleX,
float scaleY )

Set the drawing scale for rendering on the current target.

The drawing coordinates are scaled by the x/y scaling factors before they are used by the renderer. This allows resolution independent drawing with a single coordinate system.

If this results in scaling or subpixel drawing by the rendering backend, it will be handled using the appropriate quality hints. For best results use integer scaling factors.

Each render target has its own scale. This function sets the scale for the current render target.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
scaleXthe horizontal scaling factor.
scaleYthe vertical scaling factor.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderScale
3200{
3201 bool result = true;
3202
3203 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3204
3205 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3206
3207 if ((view->scale.x == scaleX) && (view->scale.y == scaleY)) {
3208 return true;
3209 }
3210
3211 view->scale.x = scaleX;
3212 view->scale.y = scaleY;
3213 view->current_scale.x = scaleX * view->logical_scale.x;
3214 view->current_scale.y = scaleY * view->logical_scale.y;
3215 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, view);
3216 UpdatePixelClipRect(renderer, view);
3217
3218 // The scale affects the existing viewport and clip rectangle
3219 result &= QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer);
3220 result &= QueueCmdSetClipRect(renderer);
3221 return result;
3222}

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_RenderViewState::current_scale, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_scale, QueueCmdSetClipRect(), QueueCmdSetViewport(), SDL_RenderViewState::scale, UpdatePixelClipRect(), UpdatePixelViewport(), SDL_Renderer::view, SDL_FPoint::x, and SDL_FPoint::y.

◆ SDL_SetRenderTarget()

bool SDL_SetRenderTarget ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture )

Set a texture as the current rendering target.

The default render target is the window for which the renderer was created. To stop rendering to a texture and render to the window again, call this function with a NULL texture.

Viewport, cliprect, scale, and logical presentation are unique to each render target. Get and set functions for these states apply to the current render target set by this function, and those states persist on each target when the current render target changes.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
texturethe targeted texture, which must be created with the SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET flag, or NULL to render to the window instead of a texture.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderTarget
2567{
2568 // texture == NULL is valid and means reset the target to the window
2569 if (texture) {
2570 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2571 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
2572 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
2573 }
2574 if (texture->access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET) {
2575 return SDL_SetError("Texture not created with SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET");
2576 }
2577 if (texture->native) {
2578 // Always render to the native texture
2579 texture = texture->native;
2580 }
2581 }
2582
2583 if (texture == renderer->target) {
2584 // Nothing to do!
2585 return true;
2586 }
2587
2588 FlushRenderCommands(renderer); // time to send everything to the GPU!
2589
2590 SDL_LockMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
2591
2592 renderer->target = texture;
2593 if (texture) {
2594 renderer->view = &texture->view;
2595 } else {
2596 renderer->view = &renderer->main_view;
2597 }
2598 UpdateColorScale(renderer);
2599
2600 if (!renderer->SetRenderTarget(renderer, texture)) {
2601 SDL_UnlockMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
2602 return false;
2603 }
2604
2605 SDL_UnlockMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
2606
2607 if (!QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer)) {
2608 return false;
2609 }
2610 if (!QueueCmdSetClipRect(renderer)) {
2611 return false;
2612 }
2613
2614 // All set!
2615 return true;
2616}
SDL_UnlockMutex
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_UnlockMutex(SDL_Mutex *mutex)
Definition SDL_sysmutex.c:108
SDL_LockMutex
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_LockMutex(SDL_Mutex *mutex)
Definition SDL_sysmutex.c:64
SDL_Renderer::SetRenderTarget
bool(* SetRenderTarget)(SDL_Renderer *renderer, SDL_Texture *texture)
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:253

◆ SDL_SetRenderViewport()

bool SDL_SetRenderViewport ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_Rect * rect )

Set the drawing area for rendering on the current target.

Drawing will clip to this area (separately from any clipping done with SDL_SetRenderClipRect), and the top left of the area will become coordinate (0, 0) for future drawing commands.

The area's width and height must be >= 0.

Each render target has its own viewport. This function sets the viewport for the current render target.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
rectthe SDL_Rect structure representing the drawing area, or NULL to set the viewport to the entire target.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderViewport
SDL_RenderViewportSet
3041{
3042 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3043
3044 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3045 if (rect) {
3046 if ((rect->w < 0) || (rect->h < 0)) {
3047 return SDL_SetError("rect has a negative size");
3048 }
3049 SDL_copyp(&view->viewport, rect);
3050 } else {
3051 view->viewport.x = view->viewport.y = 0;
3052 view->viewport.w = view->viewport.h = -1;
3053 }
3054 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, view);
3055
3056 return QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer);
3057}

◆ SDL_SetRenderVSync()

bool SDL_SetRenderVSync ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
int vsync )

Toggle VSync of the given renderer.

When a renderer is created, vsync defaults to SDL_RENDERER_VSYNC_DISABLED.

The vsync parameter can be 1 to synchronize present with every vertical refresh, 2 to synchronize present with every second vertical refresh, etc., SDL_RENDERER_VSYNC_ADAPTIVE for late swap tearing (adaptive vsync), or SDL_RENDERER_VSYNC_DISABLED to disable. Not every value is supported by every driver, so you should check the return value to see whether the requested setting is supported.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer to toggle.
vsyncthe vertical refresh sync interval.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderVSync
5733{
5734 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
5735
5736 renderer->wanted_vsync = vsync ? true : false;
5737
5738 // for the software renderer, forward the call to the WindowTexture renderer
5739#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_RENDER_SW
5740 if (renderer->software) {
5741 if (!renderer->window) {
5742 if (!vsync) {
5743 return true;
5744 } else {
5745 return SDL_Unsupported();
5746 }
5747 }
5748 if (SDL_SetWindowTextureVSync(NULL, renderer->window, vsync)) {
5749 renderer->simulate_vsync = false;
5750 return true;
5751 }
5752 }
5753#endif
5754
5755 if (!renderer->SetVSync ||
5756 !renderer->SetVSync(renderer, vsync)) {
5757 switch (vsync) {
5758 case 0:
5759 renderer->simulate_vsync = false;
5760 break;
5761 case 1:
5762 renderer->simulate_vsync = true;
5763 break;
5764 default:
5765 return SDL_Unsupported();
5766 }
5767 }
5768 SDL_SetNumberProperty(SDL_GetRendererProperties(renderer), SDL_PROP_RENDERER_VSYNC_NUMBER, vsync);
5769 return true;
5770}
true
#define true
Definition SDL_stdinc.h:74

◆ SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod()

bool SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod ( SDL_Texture * texture,
Uint8 alpha )

Set an additional alpha value multiplied into render copy operations.

When this texture is rendered, during the copy operation the source alpha value is modulated by this alpha value according to the following formula:

srcA = srcA * (alpha / 255)

Alpha modulation is not always supported by the renderer; it will return false if alpha modulation is not supported.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
alphathe source alpha value multiplied into copy operations.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureAlphaMod
SDL_SetTextureAlphaModFloat
SDL_SetTextureColorMod

1939 return SDL_SetTextureAlphaModFloat(texture, fA);
1940}

◆ SDL_SetTextureAlphaModFloat()

When this texture is rendered, during the copy operation the source alpha value is modulated by this alpha value according to the following formula:

◆ SDL_SetTextureBlendMode()

bool SDL_SetTextureBlendMode ( SDL_Texture * texture,
SDL_BlendMode blendMode )

Set the blend mode for a texture, used by SDL_RenderTexture().

If the blend mode is not supported, the closest supported mode is chosen and this function returns false.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
blendModethe SDL_BlendMode to use for texture blending.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureBlendMode
1985{
1986 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
1987
1988 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
1989
1990 if (blendMode == SDL_BLENDMODE_INVALID) {
1991 return SDL_InvalidParamError("blendMode");
1992 }
1993
1994 renderer = texture->renderer;
1995 if (!IsSupportedBlendMode(renderer, blendMode)) {
1996 return SDL_Unsupported();
1997 }
1998 texture->blendMode = blendMode;
1999 if (texture->native) {
2000 return SDL_SetTextureBlendMode(texture->native, blendMode);
2001 }
2002 return true;
2003}

◆ SDL_SetTextureColorMod()

bool SDL_SetTextureColorMod ( SDL_Texture * texture,
Uint8 r,
Uint8 g,
Uint8 b )

Set an additional color value multiplied into render copy operations.

When this texture is rendered, during the copy operation each source color channel is modulated by the appropriate color value according to the following formula:

srcC = srcC * (color / 255)

Color modulation is not always supported by the renderer; it will return false if color modulation is not supported.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
rthe red color value multiplied into copy operations.
gthe green color value multiplied into copy operations.
bthe blue color value multiplied into copy operations.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureColorMod
SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod
SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat
1855{
1856 const float fR = (float)r / 255.0f;
1857 const float fG = (float)g / 255.0f;
1858 const float fB = (float)b / 255.0f;
1859
1860 return SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat(texture, fR, fG, fB);
1861}
SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat
bool SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat(SDL_Texture *texture, float r, float g, float b)

◆ SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat()

bool SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat ( SDL_Texture * texture,
float r,
float g,
float b )

Set an additional color value multiplied into render copy operations.

When this texture is rendered, during the copy operation each source color channel is modulated by the appropriate color value according to the following formula:

srcC = srcC * color

Color modulation is not always supported by the renderer; it will return false if color modulation is not supported.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
rthe red color value multiplied into copy operations.
gthe green color value multiplied into copy operations.
bthe blue color value multiplied into copy operations.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureColorModFloat

1868 texture->color.g = g;
1869 texture->color.b = b;
1870 if (texture->native) {
1871 return SDL_SetTextureColorModFloat(texture->native, r, g, b);
1872 }
1873 return true;

◆ SDL_SetTextureScaleMode()

bool SDL_SetTextureScaleMode ( SDL_Texture * texture,
SDL_ScaleMode scaleMode )

Set the scale mode used for texture scale operations.

The default texture scale mode is SDL_SCALEMODE_LINEAR.

If the scale mode is not supported, the closest supported mode is chosen.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
scaleModethe SDL_ScaleMode to use for texture scaling.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureScaleMode
2020{
2021 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2022
2023 switch (scaleMode) {
2024 case SDL_SCALEMODE_NEAREST:
2025 case SDL_SCALEMODE_LINEAR:
2026 case SDL_SCALEMODE_PIXELART:
2027 break;
2028 default:
2029 return SDL_InvalidParamError("scaleMode");
2030 }
2031
2032 texture->scaleMode = scaleMode;
2033
2034 if (texture->native) {
2035 return SDL_SetTextureScaleMode(texture->native, scaleMode);
2036 }
2037 return true;
2038}

◆ SDL_SimulateRenderVSync()

void SDL_SimulateRenderVSync ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
5372{
5373 Uint64 now, elapsed;
5374 const Uint64 interval = renderer->simulate_vsync_interval_ns;
5375
5376 if (!interval) {
5377 // We can't do sub-ns delay, so just return here
5378 return;
5379 }
5380
5381 now = SDL_GetTicksNS();
5382 elapsed = (now - renderer->last_present);
5383 if (elapsed < interval) {
5384 Uint64 duration = (interval - elapsed);
5385 SDL_DelayPrecise(duration);
5386 now = SDL_GetTicksNS();
5387 }
5388
5389 elapsed = (now - renderer->last_present);
5390 if (!renderer->last_present || elapsed > SDL_MS_TO_NS(1000)) {
5391 // It's been too long, reset the presentation timeline
5392 renderer->last_present = now;
5393 } else {
5394 renderer->last_present += (elapsed / interval) * interval;
5395 }
5396}
Uint64
uint64_t Uint64
Definition SDL_stdinc.h:483
SDL_GetTicksNS
SDL_DECLSPEC Uint64 SDLCALL SDL_GetTicksNS(void)
Definition SDL_timer.c:624
SDL_MS_TO_NS
#define SDL_MS_TO_NS(MS)
Definition SDL_timer.h:141
SDL_DelayPrecise
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_DelayPrecise(Uint64 ns)
Definition SDL_timer.c:664
interval
EGLint interval
Definition egl.h:177
SDL_Renderer::last_present
Uint64 last_present
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:281

◆ SDL_UnlockTexture()

void SDL_UnlockTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture)

Unlock a texture, uploading the changes to video memory, if needed.

Warning: Please note that SDL_LockTexture() is intended to be write-only; it will not guarantee the previous contents of the texture will be provided. You must fully initialize any area of a texture that you lock before unlocking it, as the pixels might otherwise be uninitialized memory.

Which is to say: locking and immediately unlocking a texture can result in corrupted textures, depending on the renderer in use.

Parameters
texturea texture locked by SDL_LockTexture().
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_LockTexture
2544{
2545 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture,);
2546
2547 if (texture->access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING) {
2548 return;
2549 }
2550#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2551 if (texture->yuv) {
2552 SDL_UnlockTextureYUV(texture);
2553 } else
2554#endif
2555 if (texture->native) {
2556 SDL_UnlockTextureNative(texture);
2557 } else {
2558 SDL_Renderer *renderer = texture->renderer;
2559 renderer->UnlockTexture(renderer, texture);
2560 }
2561
2562 SDL_DestroySurface(texture->locked_surface);
2563 texture->locked_surface = NULL;
2564}
SDL_UnlockTextureNative

◆ SDL_UnlockTextureNative()

void SDL_UnlockTextureNative ( SDL_Texture * texture)
static
2524{
2525 SDL_Texture *native = texture->native;
2526 void *native_pixels = NULL;
2527 int native_pitch = 0;
2528 const SDL_Rect *rect = &texture->locked_rect;
2529 const void *pixels = (void *)((Uint8 *)texture->pixels +
2530 rect->y * texture->pitch +
2531 rect->x * SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL(texture->format));
2532 int pitch = texture->pitch;
2533
2534 if (!SDL_LockTexture(native, rect, &native_pixels, &native_pitch)) {
2535 return;
2536 }
2537 SDL_ConvertPixels(rect->w, rect->h,
2538 texture->format, pixels, pitch,
2539 native->format, native_pixels, native_pitch);
2540 SDL_UnlockTexture(native);
2541}

◆ SDL_UpdateNVTexture()

bool SDL_UpdateNVTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
const Uint8 * Yplane,
int Ypitch,
const Uint8 * UVplane,
int UVpitch )

Update a rectangle within a planar NV12 or NV21 texture with new pixels.

You can use SDL_UpdateTexture() as long as your pixel data is a contiguous block of NV12/21 planes in the proper order, but this function is available if your pixel data is not contiguous.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
recta pointer to the rectangle of pixels to update, or NULL to update the entire texture.
Yplanethe raw pixel data for the Y plane.
Ypitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the Y plane.
UVplanethe raw pixel data for the UV plane.
UVpitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the UV plane.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_UpdateTexture
SDL_UpdateYUVTexture
2355{
2356#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2357 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
2358 SDL_Rect real_rect;
2359
2360 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2361
2362 if (!Yplane) {
2363 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Yplane");
2364 }
2365 if (!Ypitch) {
2366 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Ypitch");
2367 }
2368 if (!UVplane) {
2369 return SDL_InvalidParamError("UVplane");
2370 }
2371 if (!UVpitch) {
2372 return SDL_InvalidParamError("UVpitch");
2373 }
2374
2375 if (texture->format != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV12 &&
2376 texture->format != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV21) {
2377 return SDL_SetError("Texture format must by NV12 or NV21");
2378 }
2379
2380 real_rect.x = 0;
2381 real_rect.y = 0;
2382 real_rect.w = texture->w;
2383 real_rect.h = texture->h;
2384 if (rect) {
2385 SDL_GetRectIntersection(rect, &real_rect, &real_rect);
2386 }
2387
2388 if (real_rect.w == 0 || real_rect.h == 0) {
2389 return true; // nothing to do.
2390 }
2391
2392 if (texture->yuv) {
2393 return SDL_UpdateTextureNVPlanar(texture, &real_rect, Yplane, Ypitch, UVplane, UVpitch);
2394 } else {
2395 SDL_assert(!texture->native);
2396 renderer = texture->renderer;
2397 SDL_assert(renderer->UpdateTextureNV);
2398 if (renderer->UpdateTextureNV) {
2399 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture)) {
2400 return false;
2401 }
2402 return renderer->UpdateTextureNV(renderer, texture, &real_rect, Yplane, Ypitch, UVplane, UVpitch);
2403 } else {
2404 return SDL_Unsupported();
2405 }
2406 }
2407#else
2408 return false;
2409#endif
2410}

@ SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV21

◆ SDL_UpdateTexture()

bool SDL_UpdateTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
const void * pixels,
int pitch )

Update the given texture rectangle with new pixel data.

The pixel data must be in the pixel format of the texture, which can be queried using the SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_FORMAT_NUMBER property.

This is a fairly slow function, intended for use with static textures that do not change often.

If the texture is intended to be updated often, it is preferred to create the texture as streaming and use the locking functions referenced below. While this function will work with streaming textures, for optimization reasons you may not get the pixels back if you lock the texture afterward.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
rectan SDL_Rect structure representing the area to update, or NULL to update the entire texture.
pixelsthe raw pixel data in the format of the texture.
pitchthe number of bytes in a row of pixel data, including padding between lines.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_LockTexture
SDL_UnlockTexture
SDL_UpdateNVTexture
SDL_UpdateYUVTexture
2142{
2143 SDL_Rect real_rect;
2144
2145 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2146
2147 if (!pixels) {
2148 return SDL_InvalidParamError("pixels");
2149 }
2150 if (!pitch) {
2151 return SDL_InvalidParamError("pitch");
2152 }
2153
2154 real_rect.x = 0;
2155 real_rect.y = 0;
2156 real_rect.w = texture->w;
2157 real_rect.h = texture->h;
2158 if (rect) {
2159 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersection(rect, &real_rect, &real_rect)) {
2160 return true;
2161 }
2162 }
2163
2164 if (real_rect.w == 0 || real_rect.h == 0) {
2165 return true; // nothing to do.
2166#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2167 } else if (texture->yuv) {
2168 return SDL_UpdateTextureYUV(texture, &real_rect, pixels, pitch);
2169#endif
2170 } else if (texture->native) {
2171 return SDL_UpdateTextureNative(texture, &real_rect, pixels, pitch);
2172 } else {
2173 SDL_Renderer *renderer = texture->renderer;
2174 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture)) {
2175 return false;
2176 }
2177 return renderer->UpdateTexture(renderer, texture, &real_rect, pixels, pitch);
2178 }
2179}

◆ SDL_UpdateTextureFromSurface()

bool SDL_UpdateTextureFromSurface ( SDL_Texture * texture,
SDL_Rect * rect,
SDL_Surface * surface )
static
1580{
1581 SDL_TextureAccess access;
1582 bool direct_update;
1583 SDL_PixelFormat tex_format;
1584 SDL_PropertiesID surface_props;
1585 SDL_PropertiesID tex_props;
1586 SDL_Colorspace surface_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_UNKNOWN;
1587 SDL_Colorspace texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_UNKNOWN;
1588
1589 if (texture == NULL || surface == NULL) {
1590 return false;
1591 }
1592
1593 tex_props = SDL_GetTextureProperties(texture);
1594 if (!tex_props) {
1595 return false;
1596 }
1597
1598 surface_props = SDL_GetSurfaceProperties(surface);
1599 if (!surface_props) {
1600 return false;
1601 }
1602
1603 tex_format = (SDL_PixelFormat)SDL_GetNumberProperty(tex_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_FORMAT_NUMBER, 0);
1604 access = (SDL_TextureAccess)SDL_GetNumberProperty(tex_props, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_ACCESS_NUMBER, 0);
1605
1606 if (access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC && access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING) {
1607 return false;
1608 }
1609
1610 surface_colorspace = SDL_GetSurfaceColorspace(surface);
1611 texture_colorspace = surface_colorspace;
1612
1613 if (surface_colorspace == SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR ||
1614 SDL_COLORSPACETRANSFER(surface_colorspace) == SDL_TRANSFER_CHARACTERISTICS_PQ) {
1615 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT(tex_format)) {
1616 texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR;
1617 } else if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT(tex_format)) {
1618 texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_HDR10;
1619 } else {
1620 texture_colorspace = SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB;
1621 }
1622 }
1623
1624 if (tex_format == surface->format && texture_colorspace == surface_colorspace) {
1625 if (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA(surface->format) && SDL_SurfaceHasColorKey(surface)) {
1626 /* Surface and Renderer formats are identical.
1627 * Intermediate conversion is needed to convert color key to alpha (SDL_ConvertColorkeyToAlpha()). */
1628 direct_update = false;
1629 } else {
1630 // Update Texture directly
1631 direct_update = true;
1632 }
1633 } else {
1634 // Surface and Renderer formats are different, it needs an intermediate conversion.
1635 direct_update = false;
1636 }
1637
1638 if (direct_update) {
1639 if (SDL_MUSTLOCK(surface)) {
1640 SDL_LockSurface(surface);
1641 SDL_UpdateTexture(texture, rect, surface->pixels, surface->pitch);
1642 SDL_UnlockSurface(surface);
1643 } else {
1644 SDL_UpdateTexture(texture, rect, surface->pixels, surface->pitch);
1645 }
1646 } else {
1647 SDL_Surface *temp = NULL;
1648
1649 // Set up a destination surface for the texture update
1650 temp = SDL_ConvertSurfaceAndColorspace(surface, tex_format, NULL, texture_colorspace, surface_props);
1651 if (temp) {
1652 SDL_UpdateTexture(texture, NULL, temp->pixels, temp->pitch);
1653 SDL_DestroySurface(temp);
1654 } else {
1655 return false;
1656 }
1657 }
1658
1659 {
1660 Uint8 r, g, b, a;
1661 SDL_BlendMode blendMode;
1662
1663 SDL_GetSurfaceColorMod(surface, &r, &g, &b);
1664 SDL_SetTextureColorMod(texture, r, g, b);
1665
1666 SDL_GetSurfaceAlphaMod(surface, &a);
1667 SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod(texture, a);
1668
1669 if (SDL_SurfaceHasColorKey(surface)) {
1670 // We converted to a texture with alpha format
1671 SDL_SetTextureBlendMode(texture, SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND);
1672 } else {
1673 SDL_GetSurfaceBlendMode(surface, &blendMode);
1674 SDL_SetTextureBlendMode(texture, blendMode);
1675 }
1676 }
1677
1678 return true;
1679}
SDL_UpdateTexture
bool SDL_UpdateTexture(SDL_Texture *texture, const SDL_Rect *rect, const void *pixels, int pitch)
Definition SDL_render.c:2141

References NULL, SDL_Surface::pitch, SDL_Surface::pixels, SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND, SDL_COLORSPACE_HDR10, SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB, SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR, SDL_COLORSPACE_UNKNOWN, SDL_COLORSPACETRANSFER, SDL_ConvertSurfaceAndColorspace(), SDL_DestroySurface(), SDL_GetNumberProperty(), SDL_GetSurfaceAlphaMod(), SDL_GetSurfaceBlendMode(), SDL_GetSurfaceColorMod(), SDL_GetSurfaceColorspace(), SDL_GetSurfaceProperties(), SDL_GetTextureProperties(), SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_10BIT, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA, SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_FLOAT, SDL_LockSurface(), SDL_MUSTLOCK, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_ACCESS_NUMBER, SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_FORMAT_NUMBER, SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod(), SDL_SetTextureBlendMode(), SDL_SetTextureColorMod(), SDL_SurfaceHasColorKey(), SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC, SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING, SDL_TRANSFER_CHARACTERISTICS_PQ, SDL_UnlockSurface(), and SDL_UpdateTexture().

◆ SDL_UpdateTextureNative()

bool SDL_UpdateTextureNative ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
const void * pixels,
int pitch )
static
2103{
2104 SDL_Texture *native = texture->native;
2105
2106 if (!rect->w || !rect->h) {
2107 return true; // nothing to do.
2108 }
2109
2110 if (texture->access == SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING) {
2111 // We can lock the texture and copy to it
2112 void *native_pixels = NULL;
2113 int native_pitch = 0;
2114
2115 if (!SDL_LockTexture(native, rect, &native_pixels, &native_pitch)) {
2116 return false;
2117 }
2118 SDL_ConvertPixelsAndColorspace(rect->w, rect->h,
2119 texture->format, texture->colorspace, 0, pixels, pitch,
2120 native->format, native->colorspace, 0, native_pixels, native_pitch);
2121 SDL_UnlockTexture(native);
2122 } else {
2123 // Use a temporary buffer for updating
2124 const int temp_pitch = (((rect->w * SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL(native->format)) + 3) & ~3);
2125 const size_t alloclen = (size_t)rect->h * temp_pitch;
2126 if (alloclen > 0) {
2127 void *temp_pixels = SDL_malloc(alloclen);
2128 if (!temp_pixels) {
2129 return false;
2130 }
2131 SDL_ConvertPixelsAndColorspace(rect->w, rect->h,
2132 texture->format, texture->colorspace, 0, pixels, pitch,
2133 native->format, native->colorspace, 0, temp_pixels, temp_pitch);
2134 SDL_UpdateTexture(native, rect, temp_pixels, temp_pitch);
2135 SDL_free(temp_pixels);
2136 }
2137 }
2138 return true;
2139}
SDL_ConvertPixelsAndColorspace
SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_ConvertPixelsAndColorspace(int width, int height, SDL_PixelFormat src_format, SDL_Colorspace src_colorspace, SDL_PropertiesID src_properties, const void *src, int src_pitch, SDL_PixelFormat dst_format, SDL_Colorspace dst_colorspace, SDL_PropertiesID dst_properties, void *dst, int dst_pitch)

References SDL_Texture::access, SDL_Texture::colorspace, SDL_Texture::format, SDL_Rect::h, SDL_Texture::native, NULL, SDL_BYTESPERPIXEL, SDL_ConvertPixelsAndColorspace(), SDL_free(), SDL_LockTexture(), SDL_malloc(), SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING, SDL_UnlockTexture(), SDL_UpdateTexture(), and SDL_Rect::w.

Referenced by SDL_UpdateTexture().

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_UpdateYUVTexture()

bool SDL_UpdateYUVTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
const Uint8 * Yplane,
int Ypitch,
const Uint8 * Uplane,
int Upitch,
const Uint8 * Vplane,
int Vpitch )

Update a rectangle within a planar YV12 or IYUV texture with new pixel data.

You can use SDL_UpdateTexture() as long as your pixel data is a contiguous block of Y and U/V planes in the proper order, but this function is available if your pixel data is not contiguous.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
recta pointer to the rectangle of pixels to update, or NULL to update the entire texture.
Yplanethe raw pixel data for the Y plane.
Ypitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the Y plane.
Uplanethe raw pixel data for the U plane.
Upitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the U plane.
Vplanethe raw pixel data for the V plane.
Vpitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the V plane.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_UpdateNVTexture
SDL_UpdateTexture
2289{
2290#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2291 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
2292 SDL_Rect real_rect;
2293
2294 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2295
2296 if (!Yplane) {
2297 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Yplane");
2298 }
2299 if (!Ypitch) {
2300 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Ypitch");
2301 }
2302 if (!Uplane) {
2303 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Uplane");
2304 }
2305 if (!Upitch) {
2306 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Upitch");
2307 }
2308 if (!Vplane) {
2309 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Vplane");
2310 }
2311 if (!Vpitch) {
2312 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Vpitch");
2313 }
2314
2315 if (texture->format != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_YV12 &&
2316 texture->format != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_IYUV) {
2317 return SDL_SetError("Texture format must by YV12 or IYUV");
2318 }
2319
2320 real_rect.x = 0;
2321 real_rect.y = 0;
2322 real_rect.w = texture->w;
2323 real_rect.h = texture->h;
2324 if (rect) {
2325 SDL_GetRectIntersection(rect, &real_rect, &real_rect);
2326 }
2327
2328 if (real_rect.w == 0 || real_rect.h == 0) {
2329 return true; // nothing to do.
2330 }
2331
2332 if (texture->yuv) {
2333 return SDL_UpdateTextureYUVPlanar(texture, &real_rect, Yplane, Ypitch, Uplane, Upitch, Vplane, Vpitch);
2334 } else {
2335 SDL_assert(!texture->native);
2336 renderer = texture->renderer;
2337 SDL_assert(renderer->UpdateTextureYUV);
2338 if (renderer->UpdateTextureYUV) {
2339 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture)) {
2340 return false;
2341 }
2342 return renderer->UpdateTextureYUV(renderer, texture, &real_rect, Yplane, Ypitch, Uplane, Upitch, Vplane, Vpitch);
2343 } else {
2344 return SDL_Unsupported();
2345 }
2346 }
2347#else
2348 return false;
2349#endif
2350}

◆ UpdateColorScale()

void UpdateColorScale ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
776{
777 float SDR_white_point;
778 if (renderer->target) {
779 SDR_white_point = renderer->target->SDR_white_point;
780 } else {
781 SDR_white_point = renderer->SDR_white_point;
782 }
783 renderer->color_scale = renderer->desired_color_scale * SDR_white_point;
784}

◆ UpdateHDRProperties()

void UpdateHDRProperties ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
787{
788 SDL_PropertiesID window_props;
789 SDL_PropertiesID renderer_props;
790
791 window_props = SDL_GetWindowProperties(renderer->window);
792 if (!window_props) {
793 return;
794 }
795
796 renderer_props = SDL_GetRendererProperties(renderer);
797 if (!renderer_props) {
798 return;
799 }
800
801 if (renderer->output_colorspace == SDL_COLORSPACE_SRGB_LINEAR) {
802 renderer->SDR_white_point = SDL_GetFloatProperty(window_props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_SDR_WHITE_LEVEL_FLOAT, 1.0f);
803 renderer->HDR_headroom = SDL_GetFloatProperty(window_props, SDL_PROP_WINDOW_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, 1.0f);
804 } else {
805 renderer->SDR_white_point = 1.0f;
806 renderer->HDR_headroom = 1.0f;
807 }
808
809 if (renderer->HDR_headroom > 1.0f) {
810 SDL_SetBooleanProperty(renderer_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_HDR_ENABLED_BOOLEAN, true);
811 } else {
812 SDL_SetBooleanProperty(renderer_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_HDR_ENABLED_BOOLEAN, false);
813 }
814 SDL_SetFloatProperty(renderer_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT, renderer->SDR_white_point);
815 SDL_SetFloatProperty(renderer_props, SDL_PROP_RENDERER_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, renderer->HDR_headroom);
816
817 UpdateColorScale(renderer);
818}

◆ UpdateLogicalPresentation()

void UpdateLogicalPresentation ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
2628{
2629 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
2630 const bool is_main_view = (view == &renderer->main_view);
2631 const float logical_w = view->logical_w;
2632 const float logical_h = view->logical_h;
2633 int iwidth, iheight;
2634
2635 if (is_main_view) {
2636 SDL_GetRenderOutputSize(renderer, &iwidth, &iheight);
2637 } else {
2638 SDL_assert(renderer->target != NULL);
2639 iwidth = (int)renderer->target->w;
2640 iheight = (int)renderer->target->h;
2641 }
2642
2643 view->logical_src_rect.x = 0.0f;
2644 view->logical_src_rect.y = 0.0f;
2645 view->logical_src_rect.w = logical_w;
2646 view->logical_src_rect.h = logical_h;
2647
2648 if (view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED) {
2649 view->logical_dst_rect.x = 0.0f;
2650 view->logical_dst_rect.y = 0.0f;
2651 view->logical_dst_rect.w = iwidth;
2652 view->logical_dst_rect.h = iheight;
2653 view->logical_offset.x = view->logical_offset.y = 0.0f;
2654 view->logical_scale.x = view->logical_scale.y = 1.0f;
2655 view->current_scale.x = view->scale.x; // skip the multiplications against 1.0f.
2656 view->current_scale.y = view->scale.y;
2657 } else {
2658 const float output_w = (float)iwidth;
2659 const float output_h = (float)iheight;
2660 const float want_aspect = logical_w / logical_h;
2661 const float real_aspect = output_w / output_h;
2662
2663 if ((logical_w <= 0.0f) || (logical_h <= 0.0f)) {
2664 view->logical_dst_rect.x = 0.0f;
2665 view->logical_dst_rect.y = 0.0f;
2666 view->logical_dst_rect.w = output_w;
2667 view->logical_dst_rect.h = output_h;
2668 } else if (view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_INTEGER_SCALE) {
2669 float scale;
2670 if (want_aspect > real_aspect) {
2671 scale = (float)((int)output_w / (int)logical_w); // This an integer division!
2672 } else {
2673 scale = (float)((int)output_h / (int)logical_h); // This an integer division!
2674 }
2675
2676 if (scale < 1.0f) {
2677 scale = 1.0f;
2678 }
2679
2680 view->logical_dst_rect.w = SDL_floorf(logical_w * scale);
2681 view->logical_dst_rect.x = (output_w - view->logical_dst_rect.w) / 2.0f;
2682 view->logical_dst_rect.h = SDL_floorf(logical_h * scale);
2683 view->logical_dst_rect.y = (output_h - view->logical_dst_rect.h) / 2.0f;
2684
2685 } else if (view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_STRETCH || SDL_fabsf(want_aspect - real_aspect) < 0.0001f) {
2686 view->logical_dst_rect.x = 0.0f;
2687 view->logical_dst_rect.y = 0.0f;
2688 view->logical_dst_rect.w = output_w;
2689 view->logical_dst_rect.h = output_h;
2690
2691 } else if (want_aspect > real_aspect) {
2692 if (view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_LETTERBOX) {
2693 // We want a wider aspect ratio than is available - letterbox it
2694 const float scale = output_w / logical_w;
2695 view->logical_dst_rect.x = 0.0f;
2696 view->logical_dst_rect.w = output_w;
2697 view->logical_dst_rect.h = SDL_floorf(logical_h * scale);
2698 view->logical_dst_rect.y = (output_h - view->logical_dst_rect.h) / 2.0f;
2699 } else { // view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_OVERSCAN
2700 /* We want a wider aspect ratio than is available -
2701 zoom so logical height matches the real height
2702 and the width will grow off the screen
2703 */
2704 const float scale = output_h / logical_h;
2705 view->logical_dst_rect.y = 0.0f;
2706 view->logical_dst_rect.h = output_h;
2707 view->logical_dst_rect.w = SDL_floorf(logical_w * scale);
2708 view->logical_dst_rect.x = (output_w - view->logical_dst_rect.w) / 2.0f;
2709 }
2710 } else {
2711 if (view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_LETTERBOX) {
2712 // We want a narrower aspect ratio than is available - use side-bars
2713 const float scale = output_h / logical_h;
2714 view->logical_dst_rect.y = 0.0f;
2715 view->logical_dst_rect.h = output_h;
2716 view->logical_dst_rect.w = SDL_floorf(logical_w * scale);
2717 view->logical_dst_rect.x = (output_w - view->logical_dst_rect.w) / 2.0f;
2718 } else { // view->logical_presentation_mode == SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_OVERSCAN
2719 /* We want a narrower aspect ratio than is available -
2720 zoom so logical width matches the real width
2721 and the height will grow off the screen
2722 */
2723 const float scale = output_w / logical_w;
2724 view->logical_dst_rect.x = 0.0f;
2725 view->logical_dst_rect.w = output_w;
2726 view->logical_dst_rect.h = SDL_floorf(logical_h * scale);
2727 view->logical_dst_rect.y = (output_h - view->logical_dst_rect.h) / 2.0f;
2728 }
2729 }
2730
2731 view->logical_scale.x = (logical_w > 0.0f) ? view->logical_dst_rect.w / logical_w : 0.0f;
2732 view->logical_scale.y = (logical_h > 0.0f) ? view->logical_dst_rect.h / logical_h : 0.0f;
2733 view->current_scale.x = view->scale.x * view->logical_scale.x;
2734 view->current_scale.y = view->scale.y * view->logical_scale.y;
2735 view->logical_offset.x = view->logical_dst_rect.x;
2736 view->logical_offset.y = view->logical_dst_rect.y;
2737 }
2738
2739 if (is_main_view) {
2740 // This makes sure the dpi_scale is right. It also sets pixel_w and pixel_h, but we're going to change them directly below here.
2741 UpdateMainViewDimensions(renderer);
2742 }
2743
2744 view->pixel_w = (int) view->logical_dst_rect.w;
2745 view->pixel_h = (int) view->logical_dst_rect.h;
2746 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, view);
2747 UpdatePixelClipRect(renderer, view);
2748 QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer);
2749 QueueCmdSetClipRect(renderer);
2750}
SDL_GetRenderOutputSize
bool SDL_GetRenderOutputSize(SDL_Renderer *renderer, int *w, int *h)

@ SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_INTEGER_SCALE
Definition SDL_render.h:127

SDL_DECLSPEC float SDLCALL SDL_fabsf(float x)
Definition SDL_stdlib.c:208
SDL_floorf
SDL_DECLSPEC float SDLCALL SDL_floorf(float x)
Definition SDL_stdlib.c:226

References SDL_RenderViewState::current_scale, SDL_FRect::h, SDL_Texture::h, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_dst_rect, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_h, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_offset, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_presentation_mode, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_scale, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_src_rect, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_w, SDL_Renderer::main_view, NULL, SDL_RenderViewState::pixel_h, SDL_RenderViewState::pixel_w, QueueCmdSetClipRect(), QueueCmdSetViewport(), SDL_RenderViewState::scale, SDL_assert, SDL_fabsf(), SDL_floorf(), SDL_GetRenderOutputSize(), SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED, SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_INTEGER_SCALE, SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_LETTERBOX, SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_STRETCH, SDL_Renderer::target, UpdateMainViewDimensions(), UpdatePixelClipRect(), UpdatePixelViewport(), SDL_Renderer::view, SDL_FRect::w, SDL_Texture::w, SDL_FPoint::x, SDL_FRect::x, SDL_FPoint::y, and SDL_FRect::y.

◆ UpdateMainViewDimensions()

void UpdateMainViewDimensions ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
static
756{
757 int window_w = 0, window_h = 0;
758
759 if (renderer->window) {
760 SDL_GetWindowSize(renderer->window, &window_w, &window_h);
761 }
762
763 SDL_GetRenderOutputSize(renderer, &renderer->main_view.pixel_w, &renderer->main_view.pixel_h);
764
765 if (window_w > 0 && window_h > 0) {
766 renderer->dpi_scale.x = (float)renderer->main_view.pixel_w / window_w;
767 renderer->dpi_scale.y = (float)renderer->main_view.pixel_h / window_h;
768 } else {
769 renderer->dpi_scale.x = 1.0f;
770 renderer->dpi_scale.y = 1.0f;
771 }
772 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, &renderer->main_view);
773}

References SDL_Renderer::dpi_scale, SDL_Renderer::main_view, SDL_RenderViewState::pixel_h, SDL_RenderViewState::pixel_w, SDL_GetRenderOutputSize(), SDL_GetWindowSize(), UpdatePixelViewport(), SDL_Renderer::window, SDL_FPoint::x, and SDL_FPoint::y.

◆ UpdatePixelClipRect()

void UpdatePixelClipRect ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_RenderViewState * view )
static
473{
474 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
475 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
476 view->pixel_clip_rect.x = (int)SDL_floorf(view->clip_rect.x * scale_x);
477 view->pixel_clip_rect.y = (int)SDL_floorf(view->clip_rect.y * scale_y);
478 view->pixel_clip_rect.w = (int)SDL_ceilf(view->clip_rect.w * scale_x);
479 view->pixel_clip_rect.h = (int)SDL_ceilf(view->clip_rect.h * scale_y);
480}

◆ UpdatePixelViewport()

void UpdatePixelViewport ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_RenderViewState * view )
static
430{
431 view->pixel_viewport.x = (int)SDL_floorf((view->viewport.x * view->current_scale.x) + view->logical_offset.x);
432 view->pixel_viewport.y = (int)SDL_floorf((view->viewport.y * view->current_scale.y) + view->logical_offset.y);
433 if (view->viewport.w >= 0) {
434 view->pixel_viewport.w = (int)SDL_ceilf(view->viewport.w * view->current_scale.x);
435 } else {
436 view->pixel_viewport.w = view->pixel_w;
437 }
438 if (view->viewport.h >= 0) {
439 view->pixel_viewport.h = (int)SDL_ceilf(view->viewport.h * view->current_scale.y);
440 } else {
441 view->pixel_viewport.h = view->pixel_h;
442 }
443}

static

923 /* all of these functions are required to be implemented, even as no-ops, so we don't
924 have to check that they aren't NULL over and over. */
